description:
Sri Thai is pretty damn good. They've let me down in the past but they're on an upswing right now. 

My last 2 orders have been pleasing and I'm happy to give a higher than average review.

I always say I either give 1 star or 5 stars- otherwise I'm not inspired to write up a review. 

But Sri Thai has the same caliber Thai food as most other places but charges a few dollars less. As long as they keep delivering food that's hot and fresh they'll rerain my 4-star review. 

And, God willing, if they put more ingredients in the Tom Kha, and make my food spicy with peppers instead of including hot sauce instead, they may get 5 stars!!!

By the way - their calamari is AMAZING - but only order it in the restaurant.
author: Grizzle J.

description:
Sri Thai is a somewhat lowkey Thai restaurant in SF. The prices are good and the quality is also pretty decent. The nicest feature is the yelp delivery or pickup orders, they're rather prompt so you aren't stuck waiting an hour or so for your food. 

As for the food itself, it's good ol' Thai food so curries, pad thai, pad kee mow, and the usual good stuff. It's a pretty varied menu so try not to panic order too much. That's really all there is to it, sit down, order affordable thai food, and enjoy a nice meal.
author: Derek T.

description:
Hidden gem in the sunset for Thai food that's $8.95

I love the prices and that's what'll keep me coming back

Portions are good for the price - my stomach was full!

Pad Thai is yummy. Pad Kee Mao is good too.

I'll be back!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Awesome food easy to order and delicious!!!!
Pumpkin curry it's very good you have to try it.
author: Marcello D.

description:
Great that restaurant. My BF loves this place. Even we moved to Pacifica, yes still our go to that restaurant. 
I ordered curry, pad Thai, pad see ew etc. Everything is good here. Especially I love curry here.
Good for take out too.i saw many people ordered though phone and pick up. So I don't see this place packed.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: Great food and service. We will definitely go back here once back in SF. Thanks for the delicious food.
author: Fariya M.

description:
This is an okay Thai place. The service is fair. The menu is pretty extensive. The portions are a little on the smaller side, but the price reflects this. 

The thing that is sneaky here is that they charge for a side of rice, when at other Thai places it is already included in the price of the entree....and there is no mention of this inclusion in the menu nor was it stated at ordering.

The food is alright, there is flavor, but most of the noodles and fried rice were a bit mushy. Spicy dishes are not really that spicy, so if you want spice you need to ask for more.
author: Spencer H.

description:
There is nothing extraordinary here, typical Thai food at a slightly lower cost.

The service was a bit blunt, (what do you wanna get) yet friendly and reasonably fast. The dining room is a little maze-like environment of tiered dining spaces, kind of cool...

We tried their $9.50 Cold Prawn Salad with a wonderful mix of julienne vegetables, raw onion and mint leaves. Although it seemed a bit over salty to me it had numerous prawns and was over-all quite enjoyable.

At $9.95 Their Red Curry with Pork was my favorite this evening. With quality pork slices, thick fresh veggies and a somewhat sweet yet mildly spicy red curry we would have this again.

At $8.95 their Pad Thai with Chicken just as one would expect at any other Thai restaurant.
author: Caesar A.

description:
This place is NASTY!!  Their attitude that is!  

Came here on father's day for the first time since most places were packed or closing.  We called to RSVP & got hung up before we finish leaving our name.

However, I got here thinking that ima let that go and just chill!  Ambience seemed decent, spacious table for our family of 5 + an 8 mos old infant.  The food was fair with some good & bad dishes.  

FOOD TIP:

Roasted Duck Curry: Spot on with the duck. Somewhat crunch on the outer skin and not too fatty.  The curry was not spicy and good. 

Green Curry w/ Beef: Beef what somewhat tough but it's ok because the curry was very good.  Kinda spicy (just right for me) 

Tom Kah Soup: Dirty shrimp with poop still all in there (not cleaned), but the soup was good.  You just have to pick out your own SHRIMP POO 

Pad Thai: OK; mediocre
Pad See Ew: OK; mediocre, on the sweet side, not my go to dish here

Brown Rice: Good but there are grainy parts so if you don't like that type of texture don't order this.  It's $2 each bowl to go with the a la crate dishes and curries.

WAITRESS RECOMMENDATION: Salmon & Eggplant:  Salmon did not taste fresh.  No flavoring besides fishy fishy ocean yuck with some bone bits in it. Eggplant was good.  They don't compliment each other; living in their own world in that dish.  FAIL recommendation.

Total: 3-4 star for food, but this is why they deserve 1 star

NASTY WAITRESS!!  

We had an 8 mos old at our table, my infant baby niece.  All she does (like all babies) is eat, sleep, play, cry, scream, and baby talks with high and low vocals.  With this said she's also a girl so yes sometimes her pitch can be high.  I looked around & notice the guy behind our table laughing & giggling hard with us b/c he knows how random babies are.  (8yr old at his table) I'd laugh if I heard someone else's baby do that too.  
The next thing I notice was the same waitress (PAT or PACK) who gave me poor food recommendations glaring with burning angry eyes right at my niece (the baby).  I thought it was a fluke.  maybe she just have an RBF (resting bitch face) which is natural for some people LOL... since she had that pissed look from the beginning, I just thought it was normal for her & ignored it.  

However, she suddenly became confrontational with us & told us in front of the entire restaurant to SHUSHHHH quiet & keep it down in a very disrespectful way.  It was not discrete or quiet, she looked like she want to strangle the infant!  WE WERE pretty quiet, besides baby random vocals of self blabbering & random screams..she's an 8 mos infant, just wow...!  Thought I was on the show WWYD (What Would You Do)! HAAAAaa & John Quinones was gonna come out & say we got yoU!!  WRONG!!

we are suppose to somehow silent the infant.  Or should we feel guilty for taking baby out for a family day for father's day???  

Despite what we thought inside you know we told the waitress sure yes, we'll keep it down.  My sister in law (SIL) tried to hush the baby, gave her pacifier, swing her around, (can't eat while she's doing this obviously), all sorts of baby comforting things... I mean what else can we do besides leave??? I wish they would have told us from the gecko like hey this is not an infant baby friendly place, but no... just straight up embarrass & humiliate us after they rob our money.  In the middle of eating, shut up or gtfo kind of attitude... OokKayyyy there.... 

So my SIL was going to write a review saying this place is not baby friendly to warn others, so asked another server for the RBF server's name (PAT/PACK) -I'll call her "P" for short. Suddenly P freaks out & does her weird DEATH STARE straight at my SIL with piercing eyes & said "WHAT IS YOUR PROBLEM", so my SIL explained that it is practically impossible to control an infant baby's random sounds; how can we silence a baby?  P again freaks out & points at my SIL right in front of the whole restaurant & yells, "YOU ARE THE MOM, you STOP your baby! OTHER MOMS STOP THEIR BABIES!" Like OMG my jaw drops! How rude is that to say to your customer??  So we find out she's not a mom but she's judging someone else's parenting abilities & embarrasses us in front of the whole restaurant... I THOUGHT WWYD. JOhn Quinones can come out now because that is just something out of a TV!  Such NASTY NASTY attitude from P the waitress!  

So fellow foodies, please beware of this place.  They are NOT infant/kids/children friendly unless you have a mute.

With this poor dramatic experience, I really felt bad for my Dad who had to sit there & watch this like a show for Father's day.  I really regret taking him here.  I wish it was different.  I wish P would just learn how to be a proper respectful human being so that she don't ruin people's happy day with her negative vibe, poor energy, and doom and gloom demeanor.  With that said, I wouldn't recommend this place for anyone with families or friends who have smaller ones to bring.  

Don't think I'll be back!
author: Juila L.

description:
I don't know what happened to the servers here because few years ago when I used to come often, it was NEVER this bad...

Had dinner with my family here for father's day. Server name Pat, Pak or Lek was beyond rude. I have never experience anything like it. NEVER. I have a 8 month old baby that likes to sing or scream. Halfway into dinner, Pat/Pak/Lek came to our table and told us to "SHHHH...quiet and keep it down...keep your baby quiet".. yes a baby! My baby wasn't even crying at the restaurant at all, she was just just practicing her vocals. Not once did my baby cry inside the rstaurant. Pat/Pak/Lek didn't even ask us nicely, she was rude as hell. I have never in all my years (15+ years) of working at restaurants have EVER asked any of my customers to tell their baby to be quiet. What kind of sick human being does that? This is unbelievable. 
 
I was already holding my baby and putting a binky in her mouth. She was not crying. She was just singing randomly and doing baby blabbers like what babies naturally do.

I asked the other server Tanya what that rude server's name was... it was Pat or Pak or Lek, And I was gonna just write a review on yelp to warn my fellow yelpers...btw Tanya the nice server was super apologetic because she probably was in disbelieve too at how stupid and ridiculous her co worker is.

But then Pat had the audacity to stare me down at the register and mug at me and ask "what is your problem"? She walks around and mugs at my baby. HAHAHA this bitch! I should be the one to ask what the hell her problem is. She tried to argue with me that it's a public place and people should be quiet at restaurants. Is there a sign that says no kids allowed? I asked her if she had any kids, and of course she said no. Oh thank god! She doesn't have any kids bc she would probably be one of those assholes caught on youtube that beats their kids up. She tried to yell back at me and was not apologetic at all. Not only did she sound and look stupid AF, she then goes to another table of customer n tried to justify that she was correct. Like her being rude to us can be justify. I told the customer what happened, and the other customer felt bad too. When my baby was singing and babbling, the table behind us with children was laughing and saying how cute she was. I don't know what the server's problem is. Maybe she is mad she isn't able to celebrate father's day and instead she is working? 

The server yelled at us to quiet an 8 month old, that wasn't even crying. And had the nerve to keep yelling at us. I hope she gets fired and I feel bad if she ever have kids on her own. I feel bad for all the bad ass karma she is going to have. 

I told Pat/Pak/Lek that I wanted to speak with the owner. She said the owner was inside the kitchen. Tanya said the owner wasn't here and was super apologetic. I hope the owner can see how rude this server is. No one should be paid for that kinda "service".
author: Tammy F.

description:
We walked in here at 9:17, the server tries to tell my friend and I it's closed. I tell her online it says 10. The menu says 10, online and on the sign. 

She says fine, then we sit down. The people right next to us gets served their food probably 10 minutes after we order ours. She tells me the food I try to get isn't available and insists on the pad Thai instead. 

The tables nearby us had the same type of noodles I wanted. We just ordered to go since we didn't want to dine somewhere we weren't welcomed to.
author: Casey G.

description:
I really enjoyed my food from Sri Thai! I noticed a lot of criticism for slow delivery but I didn't experience that at all... I ordered online for delivery at 9PM on a Wednesday (Yelp says they close at 10PM) so I was a little nervous it wouldn't show up or arrive super later but they delivered to my place in 30 minutes!

The food was good (I ordered Panang Curry and Pad Gra Prow) and they were both tasty!! They don't give you a spice option when selecting food so make sure you make a comment on the order for spicy (I did and the food was spicy enough for me - I used to live in Thailand so I know/like Thai spicy).

The price was pretty good too so I will definitely be ordering from here again :)
author: Jorgen A.

description: Excellent food awesome service. Found on Yelp as we are tourists. Awesome break great ambiance.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
The food here is excellent! Great service and good prices. The portions are not huge, but it's perfect for the price.

We tried the pad see ew with beef (excellent), and a sauteed chicken dish. The chicken was too spicy for me. 
Also their hot tea is very yummy, it's some sort of tea with venilla.

definitely going back.
author: Mina D.

description:
I am proud to say I finally have a go-to Thai place! I've tried a fair share of Thai restaurants in Sunset, but Sri Thai is far superior! 

They offer dishes at great, affordable prices and have a large variety of dishes on their menu. And their customer service is always great! I've also ordered pickup through Eat24, and they were extremely quick with preparing my order. 

I'd have to say their CURRIES are all very delicious and include good portions of meat and veggies. Their PAD SEE EW is also very flavorful and might just be the best pad see ew I've ever had. Their PAD THAI was a bit too sour for my liking, but the rest of the items on their menus are spot on! 

If you're looking for a delicious Thai place, look no further because you've found one! Sri Thai will not disappoint with their curries and pad see ew!
author: Alison Y.

description: Love love love this place!!!  Their green curry is my absolute favorite. I usually order delivery and they are timely and deliver fresh food. The pad Thai is never dry!  I absolutely love this place!
author: Whitney C.

description: The food and environment of this nice family restaurant is really delicious and welcoming. The place was decorated really sweetly and the servers were really friendly and attentive. The meal we had was absolutely scrumptious. Highly recommended:)
author: Natashia S.

description: Excellent thai in the Outer Sunset -- eat it there or get it to go! My favorite is the Pumpkin Curry -- either with chicken or tufo -- and with a side of brown rice. It's so delicious. My favorite take out spot. Great service, quiet spot by the ocean.
author: Dani S.

description:
Small portions.  Slow delivery.  Mediocre food.

I really don't get how this place has 4 stars.  I placed a delivery on Eat24, and it gave a generic delivery time of 45 to 85 minutes.  After 90 minutes we called, and the person on the phone said they didn't see the order until a half hour after I placed it.  So that means they don't pay much attention to that system, it's probably best to call in your order here.  

We got our food late, and for the most part, it wasn't very good.  The portions were small.  The pad thai was one of the worst we've had (reminded us of instant).  The fresh roll was cut poorly and had no flavor.  It was difficult to get a piece without ripping it apart since it wasn't cut all the way through.  The spicy basil crispy duck, while it had good flavor, seemed more like spicy beef jerky with a couple of duck pieces.  It may very well have all been duck, but most of the pieces of meat were too dry to be able to tell.  The tom kha soup was actually very tasty, not too sour, very creamy.  However, it didn't have very many ingredients in it, it was mostly broth.

The late delivery and subpar food in small portions won't have me ordering from here again anytime soon.
author: Jon B.

description: I haven't been here since I was in elementary school but I'm glad to see that it's still very delicious! We got the spicy tofu appetizer that usually comes with chicken wings but we subbed it out for fried tofu, and so glad we got it because it was delicious! Our entrees were delicious good too but the noodles seemed to be a little bit too wet. Definitely going to come back soon!
author: Kayla F.

description: Was first in the door when it opened, ordered Pad si eww, portion size was great, dont know why others are complaining about portions, their stomachs must be blown out of normal human proportions.  No reason not to give it a five.
author: Serge D.

description:
I've been going to this place for a few years now and it has yet to disappoint. Typically my husband and I would order this for delivery when staying in sunset, but this last time we finally dined in. It was the last day of our trip to San Francisco and our friends let us choose where to eat, so we suggested Sri Thai. 

There was no wait (we got there right at opening), and after a brief browsing of the menu we were ready to order. We were pretty easy though cause we all had a general idea of what we already wanted. I ordered the usual for hubby and I which is yellow curry chicken, tom kha soup, and a Thai iced tea to share. My bestie and her boyfriend got some sort of delicious flat noodles with chicken and a sampler app platter for us all to share. 

Everything was delicious, and my friends were not disappointed. 

Delicious food...great service...fair prices...steps away from the beach...AND free parking right across the street?! I couldn't ask for more.
author: Krisie D.

description:
awesome thai food for super fair prices.
I get delivered by eat24.
Always super fast
author: Adam G.

description:
Good thai food.  This is a small place located on Lincoln Way.  

Everything we ordered was tasty.  My go to Pad Eggplant was perfect.  Portions are a bit small, but prices are cheap.  I might just start ordering takeout here from now on.
author: Karen L.

description: Ridiculous. Ordered delivery, instead of promised 50-60 minutes, the order has been now at 90 minutes with promises that it's "on the way", 2 phone calls and no food up until now.
author: Julia A.

description: Worst Thai food I've had in SF. Ordered on a Sunday night and it took 75 minutes. The food was cold and soggy. Somosas and corn cakes came with a few pieces of lettuce and carrot with mayo on top?? Both were awful. The papaya salad was so bland. The mango sticky rice was a cold hard lump and inedible. Waste of time and money.
author: Barie W.

description: OMG, best Thai food I've ever had, unbelievable. Had yellow chicken curry, Thai Samosa, Veggie Spring Roll and egg plant. Portions were great. I've never had the Samosa but it's veggie with sweet potatoes as main ingredient, very tasty with the sweet sauce it's served with. The egg plant was fresh, served with other vegetables and a mild sauce. I'm sure you can ask for hotter sauce but my taste buds liked as is. The veggie roll looked like a rice wrapped veggie roll that not only tasted great but you can see through the outer layer and see a variety of different colored vegetables, almost like a piece of art. Best of all-it's NOT deep fried. Overall this is our family's new Thai place. Best of all they deliver.
author: David M.

description: Tasty fried rice with a big portion of crispy chickens. The young female waitress is very attractive
author: Sergio R.

description: Good for the price. Portions aren't as large as some other Thai places nearby but they're also not as expensive. Definitely a lot less spicy than most other places but the it wasn't a big deal since the food was still by no means bad. Delivery was fairly quick through Eat24 and got to me within an hour.
author: Graham H.

description: Good delivery, convenient but inconsistent. Not impressed with any of their appetizers or side dishes but they are nice and their curry is decent when you need to hit the spot.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Even though I gave them four stars in my previous review, the food is so good that I feel like I have to add a star. They do deliver and the delivery is fast and packaged very nicely so it's easy to eat and doesn't spill. 

The prices are truly incredible- most curries and noodles are under $10 and the portions are huge. The pumpkin curry is seriously probably the best I've had anywhere. The curry has a slight thickness and rich and well developed flavor. Tons of tender pumpkin, tofu, and all kinds of veggies are also in it. I don't normally like carrots in my curry but here they are slices so thinly that they are still a little crunchy and taste really great. There was also lots of bell peppers, broccoli, and other veggies. The pad ki mao was similarly flavorful and pretty good. I wouldn't say it was the best I have had but definitely a solid dish. 

Overall the extra star is really for the pumpkin curry which has been amazing both times I have had it. This is going to be my new go to Thai place for both eating in and delivery.
author: Seema U.

description: Yummmm!  All that we have ordered has been great.  Prices are right too!  These Elite Yelp turdballs who give one star are not fair.  If the food is good, should be more than one star.  Dear negative nancy elite yelp-turds, find something better to do with your time than writing 15 paragraph reviews on how the service didn't meet your elite standards!
author: W P.

description:
Q: What happens if you transport yourself into a loving family's home in Thailand? 
A: Sri Thai

We stumbled on this  place while looking for food on the way back from the Sunset...what a hidden gem. Their food is AMAZING (despite visiting Thailand 2 months ago) and they are so polite that it will give you a lesson or two in Manners 101. I will be back for more...a lote more!

PS: Those shrimp spring rolls and the tomyum coconut soup...!!!!!!!!
author: Tarun P.

description: Food was good, not bad, not great. We ordered delivery through Yelp and they took over an hour and a half to deliver, even though they're just down the street, and when the food arrived one of the tubs had opened and leaked all into the plastic bag. I got a bunch of the curries, which were all good, and I got some of the fresh rolls which had a yummy sweet dipping sauce, but were mostly filler veggies with a little sliver of tofu in them, so there wasn't much to them. All in all I wasn't that thrilled with them, and don't think I'll order from them again.
author: Lisa B.

description: Excellent food, excellent service, good seating, and good prices. A place to seek out when in the Outer Sunset.  Parking no issue either. Stroll the beach, watch the sun set, and go for dinner!  Right near the old windmill in GGP.
author: Z X.

description: This is my go-to place to get pad thai in the city! Their fried rice with crispy chicken is really good too!
author: Tiffany R.

description: Called in an order and picked it up on my bike. The wife dug into the fresh spring roll and noted that they were mostly lettuce.  This was a dark foreshadowing of the meal to come!  Her pad Thai was ok. My pad ga prow only filled up half the container.  Buyer beware!  If you order carry out check your container!
author: Gee W.

description:
Great Neighborhood Family Owned Restaurant 
 Excellent Service and Food . Servers are Extremely Helpfull for those Unfamiliar with Thai Cuisine.  Highly Recommend the Pumpkin Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice With Chicken Breast is Always a Favorite 
 Only Downfall With This Restaurant is Limited Seating Capacity and Street Side Parking Can Be A Challenge.
author: Gerry L.

description:
San Francisco, CA.

If you are new to this place and it is busy there is kind of a procedure. I have done it a few times so I get it. Arrive and note your place in line the best you can. No one will be there to write your name down on the waiting list so browse the menu or something . Eventually a waitress will come and write everybody's name down. The wait is not horrible, they move with efficiency, the longest I've waited was 30 minutes.
Every thing is good, the grilled salmon is generous with a delicious spicy butter on the side. Try the chicken wings just for the  sauce.
Salads are great, as are the spring rolls.
Prices are SO reasonable, even for a beer.
Dinner for four with appetizers came to less than $70.
author: Mike N.

description:
This is my husband and I's go to Thai take out place. We have been going to this place for 6 years. 

We both love the chicken tom kha, he loves the green chicken curry and I love an odd mix of things like the pesto potstickers, prawn salad, green bean salad, veggie fried rice, pad broccoli and the pad pak. I don't think I have ever ordered something I did not like.

We have never had a bad meal here, and IMO that says a lot.
author: Karen N.

description: This place is going down hill. We placed an order for over $40 worth of food. Not one thing was hot when it arrived. I called multiple times to check on the order only to have my calls unanswered. The food had good flavor but not worth the money, time, hassle or portion size. We I finally reached someone at the restaurant they simply said they were busy and nothing could be done about the quality or portion size we received. Sadly we will NEVER be back.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
Food tastes good, not overly salted, however I took 2 stars off for the following reasons:
-very small portions..prepare to be a bit hungry (my hubby was!)
-bad customer service over the phone. We hesitated to finish ordering take out after having the woman not be very polite while taking our order. Since we were hungry, we decided to give them the benefit of the doubt, but probably not coming back.
author: Mariam M.

description:
Good portions for prices less than $10.  Surprising.
Service was a little slow, I think only 1 server during lunch on a Sunday.
Food did come out early.
Panang salmon was runny and bland.  But other dishes were good, pad thai, pra ram and eggplant. 
Parking was fairly easy.
author: Claire J.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and order and eat in from time to time. There service is always prompt a super friendly. Also, I think it's the best Tom Kha soup I've had possibly ever...

Great little spot for a date or takeout...
author: Ian H.

description:
Wow - I had no idea this place existed! 

Parking - relatively easy

What's up with all the cameras? I never felt like this part of the Sunset was sketchy, but maybe I'm wrong since they're across the street from the windmill in Golden Gate Park?

The pumpkin curry ($10) is in red curry and has a small kick to it. You will need to order a side of rice. I never understood why rice isn't included. I ordered it with chicken. 

Since my friend and I couldn't choose between the appetizers, we went ahead and had the combo ($11). The pork spring rolls are yum, as well as the chicken satay (chicken on a stick) and the samosas, I would have prefered if there wasn't any prawns in it (but I'm just not a huge fan of shrimp). 

The pad se-ew (with chicken, $9), one of my favorite thai dishes was perfectly cooked without making it look or tasting overly greasy.
author: Jess W.

description:
I adore ordering out from this place on weekends and have been doing it for the last few years. I ate in when I lived right up the street and it was always great. 

Btw, no matter what the service says online, they do deliver all over the west side, so just give them a call to ask if they deliver to you.

All the curries are good here. I rarely order the other stuff but I do love their noodle dishes- pad thai and padseewe are great. I absolutely adore the green curry.  Seafood is a good option with a lot of mussels, different kinds of calimari, squid, and scallops. Across the board solid. I love that they use enough coconut milk in their curry!

Customer service is always friendly, delivery speedy, food hot, orders correct. 

Thank you, Sri Thai, for existing on this side of town. 

BIG HUGS.
author: Priya S.

description: Favorite date spot for Thai! Service is always lovely, the food is always delicious and the atmosphere is cozy and comfortable!
author: Kara L.

description: We order from Sri Thai once every couple weeks for delivery. The food is good and delivery is fast! Our favorites are yellow curry chicken, the potstickers with green curry, fried rice and excellent thai iced coffee.
author: Kathleen D.

description: Consistently great all around. I've been loyal for years at both locations. Was bummed when I moved from Inner Sunset to Outer Sunset bc I thought I'd never have Sriracha Thai anymore. Luckily, Sri Thai is their sister store apparently. No difference in menu or high quality delicious Thai food. Score!
author: Michael S.

description:
Living in the outer sunset our late night options are limited.

Thank the lord for Sri Thai, which is open until 10:30 and has a solid menu across the board.  All of the curries are delicious, the eggplant salad is great, and they are willing to add more veggies if you like vegetarian options, but are not a fan of tofu.
author: Fritz J.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai places of all time. I live in the neighborhood and eat here at least once a week. Their service is AMAZING - I have never had a bad experience there. 

Some of my favorite dishes are: 
-Corn cake appetizer (deep fried and served with sweet sauce, YUM!) 
-Pad se ew 
-Pad Thai 
-Crispy Chicken fried rice 

Choose Sri Thai the next time you have a hankering for Thai food, you won't regret it!
author: Alexis O.

description: We live above Sri Thai and let me tell you... it is a blessing and a curse!!! We order take out 2x per week MINIMUM. Love this place and the people so much!! Such great Thai food.
author: Kylee P.

description:
So good, its incredibly good. Yeah the best ever, forever on the west side.

Also, eat more curry.
P.s. the spicy life for this guy.

Yeah!
Oh yeah!
author: Nolan D.

description: Made living in outer sunset that much better.  Cannot say enough good about this place.  Walking distance from my apartment I must have eaten the Pad Se Ew prawn and side of sticky rice three times a week for a year and half ($12).  The dine in service was great too and cool location in Ocean Beach.  Friendly staff and online ordering.  A must go to.
author: Cameron H.

description: Amazing every time. Great service. Quick delivery. Curries and noodle dishes all top notch. Have not had anything I didn't like and I'm picky. Entire family loves the food. Pumpkin curry is a fave.
author: S L.

description:
Went here for the first time for a Saturday lunch cause it was close by house. Be aware that parking might be difficult as it is a tourist spot near the beach. We lucked out and found a spot.

We ordered duck fried rice, chicken wings, papaya salad, Tom yum noodle soup and Thai ice tea. Let's break it down:
1. According to the bf, the chicken wings was delicious. It is saucier than normal places I've tried but the bf likes it like that. I do not. So it depends on people preferences.
2. Papaya salad and Tom yum noodle soup was not sour or flavorable enough for my standard.
3. Duck fried rice was mediocre. The duck was crispy at least.
4. Thai ice tea was satisfactory. Bonus on the flower shaped straw.

The price was not too shabby so can't complain too much about the tasting of the food. Friendly service.
author: Tu N.

description:
The Thai Samosa and spring rolls were decent but my Pad See Ew was extremely greasy. The only flavor that I could detect was oil and the tofu had probably been re-fried. I hate wasting food but I just couldn't get myself to eat it.
The service was slow.
author: Bhavya K.

description: Good bang for your buck! They aren't super fancy, and there is a good balance of people who eat inside the restaurant, as well as those who order pick up. I'm about 50/50. I go for the pad Thai with tofu, tom kha soup (medium spice) and the yellow curry is my favorite!! There food isn't too greasy, and still filling. I like that they give a lot of options on spice level- i go for medium to hot. Their crispy duck entrees are so yummy and they are a large portion perfect for sharing. They have a lot of staples on their menu, and this is my favorite spot that is near my house. It is truly a hole in the wall, but once you try it you will be happy that you did !
author: Julie H.

description:
Service was friendly and helpful. I was served ice water while I waited, was offered warm tea. So,you ask. Why TWO stars? The food I ordered was simple, soup for two, vegetables and steamed rice. When I got home the soup was for ONE, 14-15 oz. the one qt container was close to half full.
The vegetables with bean sauce were fine, very little sauce. Plenty of rice but for $25.00 I expected a quart of soup and a pint of vegetables. I may be unrealistic.
author: Tyro P.

description: Ordered Saturday, wife and I have been vomiting and have diarrhea with a fever for 16 hours. Food poisoning is no joke. Luckily we are 2 healthy adults. Imagine if it were a youngster or an elderly person. Recovery might be a problem. Calling the health department. Horrible just horrible
author: Leo D.

description: Went last week while in SF visiting family.  While the food was very good I only gave a 3 star due to the fact that I had to ask for some spice for my entree.  At most Thai food restaurants you are given a choice of spice level however not the case here.  Last time I was in SF we ordered in from here and thought the food was very bland so I remembered to ask this time.  Glad I did!  Made a huge difference.  The reason for a low rating is that the fried appetizers we ordered were still cold in the middle, obviously cooked from a frozen state.  The broccoli that was part of my entree was also a bit cold like it was added at the last minute....very fast and super nice waitress.  Will def go again but might speak up next time about the cold food.
author: Nancy A.

description:
We've dined here regularly last 6 - 7 years (only for dinner) and also order take out from time to time.  We can walk to this Outer Sunset location, which is a nice bonus.

Their dining room is cozy, tastefully decorated with muted colors. Thai music plays softly in the background, complimenting the warm lighting.  We've received consistently good and attentive service every time.  Take out has been timely (usually sooner than time quoted) and order always accurate.

Our favorites are their Fresh Vegetarian Rolls, Pra-Ram Pork, Pad Thai w/prawns, Pad Pak w/chicken or pork, Papaya salad, Sa-tay Chicken Appetizer, Pineapple Fried Rice w/pork.  And, while not extensive, they offer a decent wine selection at reasonable prices.

I hesitate giving 5 stars, as while I'm no Thai food expert, I do believe there are other Thai restaurants in the city that offer a bit more interesting and varied Thai cuisine.  However, Sri Thai is a neighborhood gem and nice dining venue, with reasonable prices for food and beverage.
author: Nina D.

description: Pretty good.  The corn cakes were not as good as some I've had, a little tough.  All in all, a nice dinner.  I found it to be a little spicy but I was the only one in my party who did.
author: Pat P.

description: My husband and I don't understand why a simple pad Thai and basil chicken dish from a typical Thai restaurant can be so so bad. The flavors of pad Thai was just average BUT the chicken from both dishes was just unedible.. it's white meat that is old, rubbery and tastes like it was made yesterday. We did a take out and started eating as soon as my little one was fed and tucked in. What a disappointment. We don't eat out tht often but when we do, we read reviews and then try. But today's meal was a disappointment and other Yelpers did mention abt the meat quality but I thought recent reviews are so good so why not try. But no.. bad chicken quality guys.. dine in, no take out.
author: Mahi T.

description:
Sooooo disappointed. Wanted to try this place out since a lot of people mentioned how great the thai food is and how fast the delivery was and I didn't want to go out after work. Well, placed my order at 7:00 pm, got a message saying it was out for delivery at 7:48 pm and that it should be delivered by 8:02 however, it didn't get here till 8:40. Then once I signed for the delivery, the guy told me "you forgot the tip" Yeah, no. I totally understand that deliveries will take a while, especially around the time I ordered but if the delivery time exceeds the estimated delivery time then at least communicate with your customers mentioning that it's going to take a while longer. 

The food itself wasn't even hot anymore. We ordered the pad Thai, pad see ew, and green curry. I must say the green curry was actually good but in the end, not worth it. There's better Thai places out there.
author: Ezrah C.

description:
Dont you hate it when one of your favorite entrees isn't being cooked liked how it use to be?  Pad Himapan chicken is one of my favorite meals. I've ordered & devoured it for 15+ years.  It was there when I first moved into the neighborhood.  It was THE dish. It was the stay at home, order takeout, and rent a movie dish.  It was what I craved when I was pregnant.  It was the, "take my son out to eat lunch on a Saturday afternoon dish." It has been a consistent in my life.  

Unfortunately, as the years have gone by the dish has changed.  I know I must sound like a crazy person.   The potions have gotten smaller and smaller.  The bell peppers cut into huge slices and huge green onions thrown on top serving no real purpose. (Make the portion look bigger?) Sigh.  The chicken & sauce are still awesome, but alas the veggie portion needs some help.  My family rarely orders from Sri Thai anymore because we know how it use to be.  The grilled chicken entree was once big enough for 2 adults and a kid. We use to order once a week and even received Christmas cards from them.  I LOVE supporting my local restaurants and will probably still order from them certain dishes.  The Wo Sen soup is excellent when you are sick , and my son lives their sticky rice with mango.  

I guess just like everything else in this city, change is inevitable.  Here I am waxing nostalgic about a dish.
author: Pisces G.

description: Playing tour guide with cousins from Florida.  Young one wanted Thai food for lunch & found Sri Thai.  Food was fabulous, service on point.  If you find yourself near Ocean Beach, with a hankering for Thai cuisine, this is the place!
author: C K.

description:
Living nearby to Sri Thai, I had driven by the restaurant dozens of time and always wanted to go. The location is isolated from other restaurants, but don't let that keep you from checking it out; their Thai food is first rate!

When you walk in, Thai wall art and Italian wine racks decorated with artificial grapes  greet you. I will admit this kind of threw off the Thai vibe, but I wasn't too bothered by it because I was immediately greeted by an extremely cheery server who showed my friend and I to our table. 

I ordered the green curry- broccoli, carrots, peppers, and tofu for me-  with rice, and hot tea to drink. You have to order rice with the curry because it doesn't come with which is kind of a bummer, but that's pretty standard across the board. The tea came out very quickly and was delicious; there's something about Thai tea that really gets me. The curry was delicious- spicy, but extremely flavorful. I left very satisfied.

All in all, I had a very positive experience at Sri Thai and would highly recommend you check it out; support the local businesses! The only points of improvement I would say would be on the decor, but the friendly service and delicious food make up for it. They also deliver and you can order online which is a plus. Enjoy!
author: Brendon P.

description: RIPPED OFF!!! OVER PRICED!!! DELIVERING WEB DOES NOT SHOW THEY CHARGE EXTAR FOR RICE WHEN YOU GET ANY TYPES OF CURRY!!!! Do you eat curry WITHOUT the RICE? No, you've got to get the rice! The rice is charged $1.75. That's ripped off. I've NEVER seen a restaurant serves curry WITHOUT rice and you have to PAY EXTAR to get your rice. You can buy a bottle of Evian water base on that price. If you do eat curries are just like that? I don't know what's your problem. At least they need to show it on the delivering web says they charge EXTRA for the rice.
author: Kai T.

description:
1) Consistently good
2) Excellent curries (I like their green and massaman curries the best)
3) Good portion size for the price
4) Lots of people do take-out from the place so if it's not busy, don't be alarmed! 
5) A favorite with the locals
6) My favorite Thai place in the Sunset (I've tried them all)
author: Lu B.

description: This place is my go to thai food spot. Everyone is always friendly. The food is consistent and delicious.
author: Kazz E.

description: I like the food here a lot and it's quick, but minus one star because rice is extra. At the very least they should remind you to order rice to go with your curry. Didn't find out till I was all the way home with my takeout
author: Frank J.

description: Great food and good service. The food is not as spicy as food i had in thailand, but that made it just right
author: Mila C.
Brian J.

description:
Decided to try this place out because I had a mad craving for Thai food and it was close. My friend and I ordered togo and had the following:

- Pad Thai (Chicken)
- Pad See Ew (Chicken)
- Grilled Chicken

The pad thai was not too impressive, compared to other places I have had it. But the Pad See Ew and Grilled Chicken were SOLID. In my opinion, the quality of the food is very similar to King of Thai, standard and good for some quick eats.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I love Sri Thai. Living in the Outer Sunset and walking through the cold, wet fog on a quest to find dinner is always rewarded when we come here. If you want a delicious, warm, flavorful meal this is the place. 
The vibe here is very relaxed, but in a nice way. Service is always prompt and top notch, water glasses are always refilled and orders are taken quickly. 
My favorite thing on the menu is the pumpkin curry. I'm not sure if it is pumpkin or some other type of squash, but that doesn't really matter because it is delicious. The curry is made with coconut milk, red curry, bell pepper, and sweet basil. Mix it with some sticky rice and you are good to go. 
Delivery is quick too, but we live in the Outer Sunset. So not that far to go... All in all, five stars.
author: Catherine H.

description: We Love this place! Its close to our house, service is speedy, and the curries are warm, comforting, and flavorful!
author: Ashley H.

description:
Sri Thai-located in outer sunset is a great spot for curry! I've got the green curry with chicken on numerous occasion and have not been disappointed. The pumpkin curry is surprisingly delicious too, but green curry is my all time fav, for about $11, it's definitely acceptable and worth it. Sticky rice on the other hand was just alright...
Service is good and polite, food didn't take too long also, great spot again!
author: Hao B.

description: Outstanding food. The dishes were not the usual boring pad Thai but different and very tasty choices. Reasonably priced as well.
author: Odin W.

description: Friendly service, delicious food, and just around the corner from my apartment! A lot of people commented on the portion size being small but it's quite the opposite for me. I ordered Red Curry w/ Prawns, Larb Gai salad, and side rice and it lasted me for 2 solid meals! I wish both dishes were spicier but that's just my personal taste for spicy food. The curry dish was hot, flavorful, and creamy, which are all components to a perfectly good comforting meal on a cold night.
author: Thao T.

description: This restaurant is the only decent Thai rest in the area. This should only be considered as a last resort. Their food is subpar and seriously lacking in terms of thai standards. The delivery service from the restaurant seems to neglect any request in terms of condiments and utensils. My partner and I have frequently order from this restaurant, only to be severely disappointed. I do not think it is too much to ask for either hot sauce or fish sauce and some utensils with my meal. They can never seem to accommodate the simplest request that is offered at most authentic thai places. Chilies, hot spices, jalapeños and fish sauce are standard condiments for thai restaurants. Its akin to not having hot sauce or ketchup at a burger joint. Please be considerate of your patron's request Sri Thai.
author: Lynn E.

description:
Lucked out and had Sri literally just around the corner from where I was staying for Outside Lands and I was really glad to have an alternative from festival food during the weekend.

The only dishes I tried were the Tom Yum soup, fried rice, and the Thai tea, but if those are any indication of the quality of the rest of the menu then I'd recommend this joint to anyone in the area. 

Nicely done, Sri.
author: Bob Q.

description:
Sometimes you underestimate what's in your neighbors when others are talking about it.

This restaurant is within a walk range from my house and I never expected this to be good.

Tried their Drunken Noodle, Parang Curry, and of course Pad Thai, and Pad See Ew... 

Properly seasoned, enough portions, ok packaging.

Not the best restaurant in the city but this quickly become my on-the-go dinner spot.

I'd be coming back.

*Oh they are on GrubHub delivery service, which I used a lot...
author: Nathan C.

description: Went on a cute date here with a super hot guy and we got tofu spring rolls, yellow curry with tofu, and pad Thai with tofu (all vegan). It was a really perfect date after going to Ocean Beach all day. Only complaints were that they used half and half for the Thai iced tea and I asked if they could remake it with coconut milk and they said they didn't have any which is a lie because they're a Thai food restaurant!! Second they didn't ask our spice level and I thought it was very mild. But otherwise like the pad Thai and yellow curry was so dank and it was a cute first date
author: Megan T.

description: We order take out and delivery from this restaurant frequently, as well as eat in at their cute restaurant.  We have never had a bad dish.  Some of our favorites are the Tom Kha and Tom Yum soup, the pineapple rice, and the drunken noodles with beef.
author: Suzanne K.

description: I can't understand why this place has such good reviews. It's over-priced for such poor quality food. The place was really dirty; looked like the floors and windows hadn't been washed in a long time, with lots of dust and dirt in the corners. My salmon curry was rather bland, with starchy frozen peas and water-logged frozen carrot cubes. The accompanying rice was soggy and unsalted. The papaya salad was ok, but the shrimp that came with it wasn't defrosted completely. These are serious quality and food safety issues. Incredibly disappointing!
author: Wendy S.

description:
THIS PLACE. Great food for great prices, and such nice staff!

I live right around the corner, so having a yummy Thai restaurant nearby is super dangerous (although awesome for hangovers). Every time I have been there, the staff has been super nice and sweet. The portions are decent, the chicken satay and Pad See Ew are effing delicious, and the paper roses they put on top of the straws in your Thai iced teas are a super cute touch. It may not be the classiest joint compared to some other Thai places in the city, but for the price you pay, I love it!

I'm not sure why this place has any bad reviews, but then again I have never tried their delivery service. What I can say though is that if the main complaint is that they deliver food cold, then this place is doing pretty well.
author: Sam D.

description: Just called to order some food for pick up and nobody answered. It rolled over to voicemail that said the box was full.  I tried again about 20 minutes later and got the same thing. If they're still in business that is a lousy way to handle customers.
author: j d.

description: Alright I'm updating my review, I originally gave 2 stars and I'm changing to 4 stars. I gave them a second chance because I needed a break from pizza and sandwiches and Munchery was closed today.  I ordered 2 entrees and an appetizer and everything was fantastic. I will definitely will give them a third try, it was great. The only complaint I have is that rice isn't included in entrees, it's an additional couple dollars which is fine but it's just a little annoying.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Lovely little restaurant right near the beach. A great place to have lunch and then hang out at the beach. We liked the Pad See Ewe. The Panang Curry was simply amazing. The fresh spring rolls were not the best. I enjoyed the Papaya salad, but my family disagreed

The Thai iced coffee and tea were strong and delicious! Prices were reasonable.
author: Sara V.

description: This is now our go to Thai delivery restaurant in the Sunset. Been ordering from here for several months and have never been disappointed with food or delivery time. Pad Thai is amazing at any level of spicy, the grilled pork and chicken are fabulous. Can't miss with this spot.
author: Val T.

description: I love this place! Right around the corner and never a disappointment. They always give the best service, everyone that works here is so sweet and their food is amazing. My boyfriend and my personal favorites are the Pad Kee Mao which has the perfect about of spice, and the Duck Curry and the Spicy Crispy Duck. It may be way out here in the outerlands of the city, but you won't be disappointed!
author: Caitlin C.

description: TASTY!! I recommend their green curry, probably the best curry I've had. Decently priced, nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Definitely worth a stop!
author: Sarah N.

description: I left her very disappointed I came here very hungry I eat Thai food all over the city and all over the West Coast I ordered the Tom call guy the mushrooms were very old and tasted rancid the chicken in the soup was also old and did not taste good it's seem like they overspiced the soup to cover the foul mushroom and chicken. I canceled my second order walked out no tip and I told the girl I hope I don't throw up because I feel like throwing up right now
author: Pedro Proz P.

description:
If you don't like this place, then you don't know what good Thai food is supposed to be. This is as close to Thailand as you will ever get in the states. I've been to Thai places all over the Bay Area and none of them hold a candle to Sri Thai. My "go to Thai place". I especially like the Tom Kha soup, papaya salad, and their curries. Not too spicy but spice can be added upon request. 

Not only is the food amazing but delivery is very quick too! I would recommend this place to anyone in search of the ultimate Thai restaurant in the city. In my opinion, this is the best, hands down.
author: Brett L.

description: AMAZING food. The service is sub-par, but the food is so totally worth it.
author: Tammy M.

description: I was in the area and in the mood for Thai so I dropped in. I ordered two dishes, two curries if I remember, one chicken one shrimp. Both were excellent. They didn't ask if I wanted any spice which was a bummer, I usually like some. But the seasoning was good and I left very full and satisfied.
author: Will D.

description: Appalling. Spicy pad thai arrived with all the spice of cream of wheat. Tom kha gai consisted of five shrimp and ten mushrooms slices. Pointless.
author: Adam Z.

description:
Who knew there would be such a gem tucked into the depths of Lincoln Way. I sure as hell didn't until one fateful day when we drove by and I noticed this little restaurant lurking in the dark. Ok.. It's not really lurking and it's not really in the dark, but you get the picture.

Seeing all the pictures of Thai iced tea with the rose tipped straw, I knew I had to get one just for the heck of it. Thai iced tea Thai iced tea -- sweet, cold and finished too soon. 

For food, we had:

Pumpkin Curry - Just how I like my curry -- sweet, full of spices and delicious
Deep Fried Duck - This was definitely the favorite of the night. It's essentially deep fried roast duck.
Appetizer sampler - Filled with you typical Thai appetizers; egg rolls, fish cake, satays and samosas. 

The bill came out to be a little more than your regular Thai joint but I'm definitely a fan. I can't vouch for the authenticity since I'm no Thai expert but I can say that the food is authentically delicious! With that said, I will definitely be back for more.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Tasty Thai. We picked Sri Thai for lunch while at a soccer tournament in Golden Gate Park and were very pleased with this restaurant. The food was excellent with very fresh ingredients and a lot of flavor. The service was friendly and prompt. We had a group of 6 and everyone really enjoyed what they picked. I had spring rolls and red curry chicken, both very good. Definitely recommended and would go back again.
author: Jobobb S.

description: Great Thai food and quick delivery. I usually get the Pad Se Eew and the egg rolls.  My go to place for Thai in the Sunset!!!
author: Diane L.

description: Love this place, my go to place for Thai. Serves is always top notch and pleasant. They can get busy and take out can be a challenge to get your order in but overall a great place.
author: Freddie Q.

description: Just ordered delivery and it got here about 20 minutes earlier than expected. Sweet! Ordered the green chicken curry with rice and it's really tasty. I asked for it not spicy and it's still got a little spice, but I guess spice wimps shouldn't order curry in the first place. :) I also ordered the appetizer combo and the samosas were really tasty. Everything else was pretty standard. I'd definitely be interested in trying more dishes next time!
author: Dana J.

description:
I can't tell if I keep coming back because I actually like this place or because my friend lives next door.

There certainly aren't as many options here as you can get at King of Thai, but I'm pretty sure that Sri is more authentic on the scale of Americanized Thai food compared other places in the city.  On stupidly windy days in the Outer Sunset, start with the Tom-Kha soup.  It's coconutty, and I'd compare it to something, but I haven't had anything like it.  The Pumpkin Curry is also always a safe bet because you can't get it everywhere and doesn't lack in veggies or meat.  

I wouldn't drive out of my way from SOMA to come to Sri, but I have friends who will drive out here from NOPA.  There's free parking at any time of day, and it's especially a great place to stop on the way back from the beach since it's 1-2 blocks from the water and serves hottt fooooood.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I always get takeout here. Their peanut sauce is phenomenal, and I love the beef salad, too.
author: Jon G.

description:
Haven't been here in four years but it's still pretty much the same. Food is good although the Tom Kha Kai soup was a little on the sweet side. The beef salad was better and the basil crispy duck was great and so was the sticky rice with mango.

Waitresses wears traditional costumes and are attentive to the customers, refiling often our nice cups of tea. The place is small and it seems to do a lot of to-go or delivery orders.
author: Stéphanie S.

description: Sri Thai is consistently great - awesome. I've tried a few different entrees, and have settled on the Spicy Crispy Duck as the best - it's delicious! Also, there's rarely a wait to be seated and the staff are extremely friendly and warm. I would highly recommend this spot and my favorite entree to others. Spicy Crispy Duck!
author: adam m.

description: My wife and I eat here fairly often.  We usually order the papaya salad, coconut soup, Pra-Ram Chicken and perhaps something else and a glass of wine each.  Food is very tasty, but not hot and spicy.  In fact this is about the only Thai restaurant where I can eat papaya salad.  In others it's usually too hot for me, but at Sri Thai it is just right for my taste.  Service is always gracious and good.  It's a comfortable, reasonably quiet restaurant, great for a couple, but also great for small groups.
author: Bob S.

description: The pad thai & fried chicken over fried rice were phenomenal! New favorite Thai restaurant in NorCal (:
author: Ehi I.

description:
I went to Sri Thai last night for dinner with my family and was extremely disappointed by their food.  None of the food that we had was very good or authentic. THE ONLY REASON I EVEN CONSIDERED THIS PLACE WAS BECAUSE IT HAD A 4 STAR RATING.  THANKS YELP!

We had two bowls of the the Tom Yum soup.  One with shrimp and one with chicken.  This is a very staple soup for a Thai place and should be an indicator of whether or not the food will be any good.  Well, this is when I first doubted the 4 star rating that this place has.

The soup was watery, bland, and overly sour.  I believe there were only a few pieces of chicken or shrimp in each bowl.  I was already put off that there were no family options for the soup, but the flavor and quality were sub par.

My Thai iced tea came after that.  This was more of a syrup than a drink.  It was extremely sweet, and when I asked if they could water it down with some tea, they only offered me hot tea.  This means that the Thai tea base was pre-mixed.  It just gets worse and worse doesn't it?

Next up was the papaya salad.  This salad was just sad.  It came on a tiny plate, and if that wasn't enough, there was a bed of iceberg lettuce underneath it.  This was obviously a cost saving tactic.  The taste was also off as it wasn't spicy and definitely didn't have enough peanuts.

Then came the pad see ew and the pineapple fried rice.  Both were embarrassingly small portions.  On top of that the pineapple fried rice was burnt.  BURNT!  There were specs of black in it.

Last to come were the pumpkin curry and the green Thai curry.  Not much to say about either of these, except that I think they may have mixed up the sugar and the salt.  I know Thai curries are sweet, but these were practically deserts!  Also the pumpkin curry just tasted like a red curry with pumpkins in it.  If that were the case, it should of been listed as red curry, you can choose if you want pumpkin thrown in.

I hope this makes you as disappointed as my stomach was last night.  Go to King of Thai instead.  You get the food quicker and it tastes better.
author: Eddie C.

description:
I've been coming to Sri Thai on random occasions for the last three years due to the convenient fact that my friends live in the residential complex right next door (and by right next door I mean the next number down the street.)

Sri Thai has some of the best pad thai, pad see ew, and by far the best fried rice I've had in the city. My friend also testifies that the thai tea here (despite the fact that it's poured out of a pitcher into a Fabri-Kai plastic cup filled with ice) is laced with some sort of addictive crack.

Sri Thai also caters, making it the perfect metropolitan yet douché choice for birthday parties for your toddlers at Golden Gate Park.

Oh, and the crispy chicken fried rice here is beyond godly.
author: Scott S.

description:
Very less quantity - not at all up to expectations - from next time onwards please bring something extra from your home to eat.
More intelligence showed up when - they charged gratuity for 4 people - how ever we had 2 kids of 1.5 years and 3 years and we didn't ordered any kids food.
Not recommended for family.
author: Raman K.

description:
I had heard this was a great Thai place, but perhaps because I ordered delivery it wasn't as good as dine-in. 

I usually stick to the burger and fries of Thai food when I go to a new place: Chicken Pad Thai, Satay Chicken and a Thai Iced Tea. 

Well...my food was alright. I had gotten a recommendation from my aunt who has dined in before with some pals and she said it was good. The Pad Thai was bland and had a weird tart/sour flavor I couldn't put my finger on--it wasn't lemongrass, so I'm wondering if something had turned and they didn't know. The Chicken Satay was alright--not great, not bad. But it tasted like someone melted chunky peanut butter in a dish and called it Satay sauce. Meh. 

I had ordered a large Thai Iced Tea, and instead they brought me two and charged me for two, instead of a large size. 

My aunt enjoyed her items (corn cakes and beef salad). The food came very quickly, and everything was still hot when it came. 

I will definitely dine in next time. Perhaps Thai does not translate well for take out. We shall see.
author: Bianca U.

description: So much yum!! I have been here for dinner and the service is fantastic. I hate spicy food, but their pumpkins curry was delicious. Definitely a place I see myself again.
author: Allan S.

description: Delicious! And really reasonably priced. Not to mention we got our food really really fast. 70 dollars fed five of us plus appetizers and a soup.
author: Shaylee C.

description:
Like most other restaurants in the city, parking is on the streets. But, here is a tip, you can park it for free at the Ocean Beach parking lot and walk here (just 5-10min walk). 

I ordered a Red Curry with Tofu and the food arrived soon. The portion was generous and the curry had a lot of vegetables. Tasted good, actually very good!

Definitely a 4 star and would like to return when I am around in the neighborhood.
author: Anu M.

description:
Came here for lunch on our beach day. We had a large group but they were very accommodating as we organized ourselves.
I got the pumpkin curry with pork. It doesn't come with rice but the person sizes are huge. I could've shared with a friend but some of my bigger friends finished (but we're very full). It was really good, with chunks of pumpkin and a creamy, flavorful sauce. I also got thai ice tea which was delicious as expected. Enjoyed the food very much, would come again!
author: Emily Z.

description:
I have tried multiple things on multiple occasions, and I can't give a positive review of any dishes I've explored. The service is always prompt and extremely, sincerely courteous, but the food just isn't on par with other options in the Outer Sunset, let alone the Bay Area.

After trying various dishes, I decided to go super simple tonight: Pad Thai, with chicken, medium spicy, with extra vegetables. There was little chicken in the entire dish, maybe 4-5 small bites' worth, and what chicken was there was nearly cold. (This was despite the food arriving thirty minutes before expected delivery, which was initially a pleasant surprise.) The food was not spicy in the least; it was fairly bland, and oddly stuffed with carrots. (A LOT of carrots, evidently the "extra vegetables.") The appetizer/spring rolls with pork were fine, though only lukewarm, and the sauce to go with them was solid. I would recommend those to anyone. Unfortunately, I simply couldn't make headway on my entree. After eating less than a quarter of it, I had to give up on it. 

Vanida Thai, among others, have proven much more reliable, with richer flavors and more consistently generous portions which actually reflect one's order (actually spicy, more even mix of meat/vegetables, etc.). It's unfortunate too because this is so convenient to our apartment in the Outer Sunset, and certainly because everyone I've encountered at Sri Thai is so friendly and courteous; their food just isn't worth it.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I have to give this place 2 stars.

The food is usually excellent, except for tonight... The flavor was still good, but half of my platter was cold....but here's the main reason I have to give it a 2...

The delivery drivers are such jerks. I'm .8 miles away from this location, how mad can you be about delivering to me? And, uh, it's your job. I purposely didn't tip after attitude I received, and then he had the audacity to ask for one. Sorry, but if you can't be pleasant than you're not even getting 10%. I was actually scared to be home alone after this guy left. Terrible.
author: Mandi K.

description: This place probably suffers because the Thai around the corner on Judah is pretty sensational. Nevertheless, this is good solid Thai food that I'd recommend to anyone. Think the meat could be in bigger chunks and the rice could be a little more generous, but honestly, this is good food.
author: Fi M.

description:
Nope.  Just like I judge every mexican restaurant by their salsa and chips (I mean seriously if your chips and salsa suck burro, how can I expect anything more of your menu? Ole!) I judge thai restaurants by their Tom Yum Soup.  I ordered Tom Yum with chicken "EXTRA, EXTRA SPICY PLEASE! Thank you!" from Eat24hours, my personal bartender/concierge...I dont think I was being subtle.  Showed up not spicy.  And dont just take my word for it...my newborn, who cries all the time, had some and didnt even whimper...  I'm just kidding she doesn't cry that much.  But seriously not good. 

Additionally, Mark talks thai like Jack talks thai and I have eaten my share of this ambrosia in my day (trust me, thats a long time); they added carrots and cabbage but skipped out on the fresh basil, whole mushrooms and tomatoes that routinely come with the soup?  Weird, like alien abduction weird on the Fox channel when they pretended to dissect one of the little green bastards.  I won't order again.  Our other items, prawn rolls (greasy, small and pathetic, like my old roommate), spring rolls (ok), Tom Ka soup (fair).  All in all, the only 10 given out on the meal was for the rice.  With the amount of competition out here on Clement and Geary I can't fathom the reason I would bother to order from them again.  I know the internet thinks highly of Tom Cruise so I close with the immortal words of Maverick, Sri Thai "you stink".
author: Mark C.

description: To the restaurant's defense, we ordered delivery during a UFC fight and big storm. The food took a really long time (90+min) and was lukewarm when it arrived. I got chicken Pad Thai and it was pretty good, nothing special. I would eat there again and try something different.
author: Meagan S.

description: I would give the pad thai a C. There is nothing wrong but nothing particularly right either. I may try another dish some time and update. I would not come out of my way to come here.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Had Sri Thai for delivery today.  Was craving some kind of Asian food once my family and I got back from a camping trip and didn't want to go back out into the world after a long drive back home and unpacking.

Highlight: The wonton wrapped shrimp.  Crispy and tasty with two sauces that were not too overpowering.  I liked dipping the shrimp in both the sweet and sour and soy sauce with pepper sauces. 

Other items we had were A-OK.
Pad Thai Tofu: This may taste better if eaten at the restaurant.  When I was taking my portion of the pad thai from the delivery plastic container, the noodles were clumped into one big irregular ball of noodles.  The pad thai had big pieces of broccoli and I'm assuming burnt pieces of flattened scrambled eggs.  There was something off about the noodles.  I still can't really figure out what was off about the taste of the pad thai....  I ended up finishing most of the noodles anyways because my husband didn't want to eat any more of it even though he was the one that suggested pad thai noodles over pad sae ew.  Should have gone with pad saw ew.  More often than not, that's the safer choice.

Papaya Salad:  Vegetables were crunchy but the dressing could have been brighter.  Dressing tasted watery.

BBQ Duck:  The duck was not overpowered with saltiness or sweetness, which I find happens often at various other places that offer BBQ duck.  It was a good balance between the two, so I was able to enjoy the flavor of the duck meat.  I also appreciated that there were decent amounts of meat given to us.  There's been a lot of places where I've been given a lot of bone and not a whole lot of meat.  At Sri Thai, that was not the case.

I have been to Sri Thai several times before, and honestly, it's been a hit and miss.  I really want to enjoy the food here because it's so close to home and there aren't a lot of options in the Outer Sunset.  I once tried a fried fish dish that was really good, but when I had it the second time, I wasn't as excited.  I'm going to keep Sri Thai as an option to go eat in the neighborhood though.  I'm hoping to relive that wow moment I had when I first tried Sri Thai many moons ago.
author: Nhi P.

description:
This place is the worst and i eat Thai food in San Francisco, the Peninsula, and I've eaten it in Thailand and this place wins absolutely hands down as the worst Thai restaurant I've every been to. We came here hungry and ready to chow down. 

To start off  with the waitress was unfriendly and smiled only once when we were leaving. She also didn't check with us during our meal to see if the food was okay. Basically she sat us down, took our order, brought us what we ordered, and then the check all without making eye contact or a smile. 

So we started off with the veggie spring rolls which were cold as if they were cooked ahead of time,  We also ordered the green curry with tofu. We thought the green curry was really watered down. We also ordered the pad se-ew flavorless. We also ordered the salmon eggplant which we found to also be tasteless. We also ordered sticky rice which tasted like it was overly microwaved which dried out the rice. 

Overall, I found the service unfriendly, and the food lacking flavor and taste. If you want good Thai food DON'T stop here.
author: K A.

description:
I don't get many complete weekend days/nights to myself, that's just the way it is, not complaining.  

But a few months ago the stars aligned, and there I was with a Saturday morning,  afternoon, and night with zero commitments, zero plans.  I slept in.  I hit Urban Ore for some quality treasure-hunting.  Next stop Missouri Lounge for a few very decent cocktails on the patio.  On to Ocean Beach to watch the waves crash and the ships pass.

Final stop -  dinner in the Outer Sunset.  A drive-by find, which was quite a feat considering it's a tiny little place tucked away between buildings, stashed behind trees and parked cars on Lincoln Ave.  Sri Thai is humble on the outside, and inside it's dimly lit and very red.  There's limited seating... hope to get one of the tables near the window.

The curries were delicious and the service couldn't have been better.
author: Meg W.

description: Ordered delivery waited over an hr for my food. Food was cold when I got it. Had the Prawn rolls which would have tasted a lot better of it wasn't cold and Pad se-ew bc of the ratings but it was way to greasy! Portion sizes are small. I was not too impressed with the food.
author: Ria D.

description: Absolutely love this place. Delivery was on time, food was hot and delicious. By far the best customer service I have received through delivery apps. Usually I don't expect much but this place definitely exceeded expectations
author: Jasmine W.

description:
Great service, cheap and fast and the best part is they deliver for free.  If you are tired to cook and super hungry, call them up.
I will come back and try their other salads.  Will also have to try their entrees, especially the short ribs.
author: Claudine V.

description:
8:30pm on a cold, foggy Outer Richmond evening, and I'm too tired to cook.  I looked up delivery on Yelp and called this place out of the blue.  The very polite lady answering the phone took my order, despite my hypoglycemia-induced indecision over what to get.  There was a $15 delivery minimum charge, but no delivery fee...so I had to order two entrees (no problem - now I have lunch for the next day).  She recommended that I get the pad see yew with beef ("it's really yummy that way," she says), and I also ordered a pad thai with chicken.  They take American Express, hooray!  She tells me it will be 45 minutes....how will I survive that long??  I had to have a snack.

Anyway, food finally arrives (it was an accurate time estimate, unfortunately for my hungry tummy).  Very nice delivery guy.  I decide to eat the pad thai and save the pad see yew for tomorrow's lunch.  First thing I notice when I open the bag is that something smells a bit stinky.  I open the pad thai container and I realize it's the cabbage that is on the top of my dish.  I don't think I've ever seen pad thai with cabbage before (bean sprouts, of course..but cabbage?).  Anyway, I dug in, pushing the cabbage aside.  I wasn't blown away, but it was decent.  The chicken was a bit dry (as it sometimes is when they slice it really thin in Thai food) and the flavor was only okay.  But I ate half, and saved the rest.

I ended up eating the pad see yew for two meals as well.  It was much better.  The beef was really good (I strongly recommend this over the chicken!) and I liked that the broccoli was just al dente and not mushy at all (a pet peeve of mine is mushy vegetables!).  The flavor was good, and there was plenty of beef and egg in there.  The only thing is that it was kind of oily.  But it was goooood.

For saving me from hunger and the good flavor and quality of the beef pad see yew, this place gets 4 stars and a pledge from me to order again to try more things.  I would not re-order the pad thai, so I'm still on the lookout for a good delivery pad thai spot.  A future review awaits!
author: Caroline K.

description: This is my favorite Thai spot in the city! I come here with my GF all the time! Service is good and quick and the staff is nice and the food is even better! I ALWAYS get the yellow chicken curry when I go here, I've had quite a few curries and this is my favorite! Usually I run out of rice just eating up all the sauce after my chicken is gone! My GF always gets the Pad Se Eww with prawns and it must be super good too since she gets it literally every time we go here! I would recommend this spot if you're in this area! Yummy!
author: Blaine S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but I won't  be back. 

What we ordered:
Corn cakes: tasted like they used canned corn and the cakes were dense and kind of gummy...not light and crisp 
Egg rolls: typical 
Pad thai - the noodles were kind of chewy and the sauce had a thick texture, but the flavors were there 
Beef salad - weird vinegary taste
Pad kra pow - pretty good.

Service: They didn't say much the whole time and they never brought the extra hot sauce we asked for. And when we asked if they could switch the tv channel to the baseball game that was on, they said okay, but didn't follow through. The service wasn't bad or anything, but  they didn't make the effort to be friendly. 

Overall, everything was just average. 

The thai iced coffee was yummy though.
author: Deanna Y.

description: We have been looking for a good thai food spot that delivers to our neighborhood and we have finally found it! The food was very flavorful, delivery was within 45 minutes, and the portion sizes were actually adequate! In the past when we have ordered from other thai places the portions have been quite paltry and over priced.  An added plus for  Sri Thai is they were super accommodating when we needed to add an extra entree after we had already placed our order online through yelp. Thank goodness this is our go to thai spot for delivery because who can live without thai food on demand?! Not us!
author: Shayla D.

description: Very warm and inviting service. They even make little roses out of the paper the straw came from and attach it back on the straw. The yellow curry chicken and vegetables is creamy with subtle coconut milk, it's divine. Add corn cakes, grilled pork, veggie spring rolls, pad thai, it's a fat kid's paradise.
author: Livia K.

description: Great ambiance and delicious food. You need to cry the coconut  ice cream and friend banana. It's honestly one of the best coconut ice creams I've ever tasted! I had the pad see ew with chicken and it was the bomb.com .Yellow curry and red curry are also very delicious! It's also super close to the beach! My friends and I spent a day at the beach and then crossed the street for some delicious Thai food and it was such a great choice. If you're in the area or taking a run at the beach you should definitely  try this place!
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to get Thai in the City. Don't let the outside fool you, the restaurant is clean and cozy and the food is always delicious. I get take out from here frequently and am never disappointed. 

Their Pad See Ew is really good, but I'm particularly fond of their curries. The Red, Green, and Pumpkin curries especially are my definition of perfection. Plus, when I tell them I want my food to be spicy, they make it spicy. 

If you're in the Sunset and looking for good Thai food, look no further. This place is fantastic.
author: Eric L.

description: Great food and always quick too. I normally order for pick up and take a walk through the hood to get it. I like having a local Thai place that's probably the best I've had! I would recommend this place for sure. Well I gotta go pick up an order now as I don't want it to get cold!
author: Phil D.

description: I love this place I found this back in my high school days wow it been so long stile love this place food always been good and very nice people are working God bless to your business and you guys
author: Claude C.

description:
Ordered some takeout on my way home from Golden Gate Park.

I was greeted upon entering and the waitress let me peruse the menu since I hadn't decided what to order. While I was looking she brought me a glass of water which was awesome since I was pretty thirsty after walking all the way through the park. I ordered the spring rolls (not fried) and the red curry with chicken which came out to around $18.

The food took 10-15 minutes to come out but there were seats near the door so I was able to sit and chill while I waited. When I got home I shared the food with my boyfriend, and we agreed the curry was pretty good. I enjoyed the addition of eggplant in the mix which is something you don't see that often, and the sauce was spicy but not overpowering. They also packed the curry in a nice, spill-proof container which was legit. The spring rolls were pretty ho-hum, nothing too exciting. They weren't very flavorful and I didn't care for the sauce that they served with them so I would recommend passing on these.
author: Sam F.

description:
Recently, I have embraced the glorious phenomenon of delivery with no shame. I've probably had close to 5 Sri Thai banquets on my bed. Maybe I'm lazy, but who else gets home after 9 hours of work and loses the will to do anything including cook? Probably most normal humans. On these such occasions, Sri Thai hasn't let me down. 

It goes without saying, but they're always great to work with. Friendly and receptive phone service, and rapid delivery results. Not to mention their prices are very reasonable.
