I always go with an order of Tom Kha. Always. It's literally hot perfection in a bowl. The coconut makes it deliciously creamy and thick, but the lemony flavors keep that in check. I've never liked mushrooms until Tom Kha entered my stomach, and Sri Thai's makes mushrooms kind of crazy good. 

The Pad Thai is great -- lots of flavor, lovely texture, and is always a go-to dish. Same goes for the Pad See Ew. Order with confidence! 

Chicken skewers are darn tasty -- slather them in peanut sauce and blow each tiny mind in each of your tiny taste buds. 

One day I might make it to Sri Thai and actually sit in their restaurant, but the great service and tasty food I get in my bedroom might delay that occasion.
author: Chelsea B.

description: This place is off the chain. I live less than a minute away and order here all the time. Their Tom Kah Soup is delicious and all of their curry is some of the best I have had. I can not speak on behalf of authenticity, but as a frequent thai food eater from many different spots, I give it 5/5 easy. Plus staff is super friendly
author: Harrison K.

description:
I love the pumpkin curry here. The rest of the dishes I've tried, not as much, but not bad: satay chicken, pad thai, pad see ew. The roast duck was also good, but unfortunately dry.

Was that Comic Sans on the awning?
author: Maximillian M.

description: very good Tom Kha.  Sticky rice and peanut sauce are a kid favorite.  We''l be back for sure
author: Scott L.

description: Great curries & noodles.  Service was 5 stars.  Tough to get 5 stars in SF, but it's pretty dang close.
author: Blake P.

description:
Ordered delivery from here earlier this month.  Delivery came in about an hour and was packed well.  Came with napkins and silverware.  Always a plus.  On to the food...

Spring Roll (w/ Pork) - Wanted something fried so spring rolls seemed like the thing to order.  They were nice and crispy and very tasty!

Papaya Salad (extra spicy) - I always order everything extra spicy so I'm glad this was actually spicy!

Pad Thai with chicken (extra spicy) - A little on the bland side.  Wasn't as spicy as the papaya salad which was a little disappointing.  I like a little heat in my thai food is you can't tell. Hehe!

Green Curry with beef (extra spicy) - Again a little bland.  But it was a good size and had a good amount of meat and veggies.

Fried Rice with prawns (extra spicy) - Ate some of this with the curry and some of this with sambal.  By itself it was nothing to write home about, but I did enjoy eating this with the curry.

All in all an okay experience.  I liked that they made most of the dishes extra spicy cuz I like my thai food spicy, but other than that most of the food was just average.
author: Elena N.

description: Good for a quick meal or take out. Satay is pretty good, Pad Thai is average, and Thai ice tea is good. The only turn away is that where the restaurant is located on Lincoln, it smells like sewer.
author: Virginia C.

description: This is the best thai food I've ever had. I always have to order the Pad Thai, it's addicting!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Surprisingly good thai food. I hate going to a thai restaurant that serves subtle flavor, I think we can all agree that subtle thai food is an oxymoron. My friend order fried chicken over thai fried rice and I was a bit envious of his choice. Usually the fried rice that comes with the fried chicken is pretty basic, but damn it was good. Enough to make me want to order it on its own without the chicken. I myself ordered the pepper and garlic pork and it was gone shortly after it touched the table. I might have left 2-3 grains of rice which I usually would clean up but was too lazy from a stomach full of food, portions are appropriate for a hungry man. And it was cheap. Most dishes under 9. Decor was lovely, dark and warm, like most thai places I'm akin to. They dress up their place a little more than usual with the waitresses in very traditional looking dresses. Close to the beach so there's plenty of parking. How nice to walk on the beach to your car after dinner? I bike but, how nice anyways. Will def go back.
author: Elton F.

description: Little hole in the wall family run Thai restaurant, this is the best place in SF for Thai food hands down!!!!
author: Geoffrey M.

description: This place is a little hidden gem. Is cute and cozy. The service is quick and the food is very rich in flavor. I had the Tom yum which was delicious. The samosas were okay but the pumpkin chicken curry was so good it made up for it. Very affordable too.
author: Chiara M.

description: Good flavor and excellent friendly service. Place is a little old. Could take some renovation and/or updated ventilation. An excellent choice for delivery or take out.
author: Mido A.

description:
I'm not surprised that this place doesn't have any 1 star reviews.

Came in around 5:20PM today, there were only a few others there. I've walked by it around 8 or 9PM and it was a lot more crowded.

Had the...vegetarian thai samosas http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lOSf40Yd3s29fY5bj72IOw?select=mArTsdB8ZFGosPZuqKL2uA , green bean salad, pad thai with beef http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lOSf40Yd3s29fY5bj72IOw?select=cE7R8rVh4aqvJfBJuUf69Q and green curry with beef http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lOSf40Yd3s29fY5bj72IOw?select=FqytitfHkmLAsbIq5DAA_Q . The best items were the green curry and samosas. I don't know if I'd get the green bean salad, well...I'm not really a salad person. The pad thai was very vinegar-y.

I would come again. The reviews on yelp for the place made it sound extraordinary, it was just a normal okay restaurant.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Fairly decent Thai Food, the Pineapple Fried Rice, Pad Thai and Chicken Satay were awesome!
I usually do take out, except on weekends it is much better to order and pick it up....
author: Mo D.

description:
Great place! Awesome appetizers, the somosas were nice. And the pad see ew was amazing, and I have had a lot of them. 

I would definitely come back again!
author: Rachel S.

description:
I always judge a Thai Restaurant by how good their green curry is. So far, this is the best place I've ever had green curry. The ambiance is nice. Nice lights, wine bottles everywhere, clean, not crowded, fast & friendly service. Couldn't ask for more in that aspect.

I always check a restaurant's reviews and menu online before going to a place and I like their system for online ordering. They deliver or you can pick up. Prices are good too.

I'll go over the food we had there now:

Green curry - thick and soupy. Just the right spiciness. I liked the addition of cucumbers, which tasted very good with the curry. Chicken tends to get overcooked as usual with curries. Everything in the dish went well.

Spicy Fried Snapper - The breading was kinda tough to cut through with the spoon. They didn't give us knives lol but it was tasty. The "red curry" was moreso just a spicy sweet & sour sauce. The fried basil leaves on top were delicious! Kinda like really thin potato chips, but they were tasty basil leaves!

Brown rice - They had run out of white rice for the night and gave us the brown rice for the white rice price :) That makes me happy. I could hardly tell it was brown rice, but it still had that slight chewiness that brown rice has. Very plump though!

Wanted to try the fried banana and ice cream, but we were too full.

Woulda gave this place 5 stars if we didn't get the runs a little the next day :\ but I'd still come back hahaha it tastes good and a little bit of extra bowel movements won't hold me back!
author: Timothy L.

description: Super delicious! Came here for dinner tonight with my family. We had the spring rolls, chicken satay, grilled pork and yellow curry with chicken. Everything was very flavorful. We topped off with fried banana and coconut ice cream for dessert (so refreshing). I can't believe I haven't been here since only a block away from this place. Definitely coming back soon!
author: Michelle D.

description:
A three star place for now.... with a chance to be a 4 star place. 

We ordered Red Curry Tofu and Spicy noodles. The red curry tasted good and the consistency and the portions were pretty good. The only downside was that it was missing the aromas that make Thai curries stand out. In addition, they also made it medium spicy when we asked for extra thai hot. The Spicy noodles were very tasty and it's definitely a dish that would drag me back to this place. 

This my criticism when it comes to most of the Thai places in the bay area. Not giving a side order of rice for something you can only eat with rice seems a bit sneaky way of charging higher prices...and then charging for a refill of rice seems that much more unfair. I really hope Thai places change this. Here at least for me, the side of rice wasn't large enough to go with the curry portions.
author: Ravi C.

description:
Surprise surprise! this tiny place hidden all the way in the outer sunset.

first off, yes its a 4 star yelp place, but when i read reviews, they seemed so mediocre, i was afraid to try it! but we had a living social $10 off deal that we wanted to use, and this place was the closest thai that wasn't king of thai.

ordered to go:

pad thai- after trying the pad thai in thailand, i was really hoping that the pad thai would taste like it did in the homeland, and by golly! it was close!! the noodles were not clumped together and they give a good amount of meat and eggs! The flavor was a bit too sweet but it was good. (maybe i never gave pad thai a chance cuz KOT never  made it well...) but thumbs up here

grilled chicken- very simple, but good.

pumpkin curry- not much of a curry fan anymore, but this was good also.

pleased with what we had for dinner and satisfied!
author: Christine M.

description: Fantastic food, always order the tomm kah soup, its one of the best I've ever had. Today we got tomm kah, spicy drunken noodles, pumpkin curry with white rice. I always come here whenever I'm in SF
author: Eric G.

description:
Sweet baby Jesus in a manger: their mango with sweet sticky rice, I could eat that for the rest of my life.

That's it. That alone deserves five stars. They're docked one, though, for Thai food that's just alright, nothing amazing. 

Service is decent, prices are fair, and yes, they deliver (with a $15 minimum purchase). Just get three orders of the mango with sticky rice and you're set. What more could you possibly want?
author: Adena B.

description: I love the pad Thai and Tom Yum. They were delivered fast and hot although I ordered around 10pm. Will order again when I wanna taste some Thai food
author: Thanh N.

description: Made a reservation for Christmas Day.  Showed up on time but they were closed.  FAIL.
author: Neal S.

description: I am at a complete loss for words. I work in the restaurant industry and I realize how difficult it can be so I decided that because I had a good couple weeks in tips that I would leave a  nice tip for my delivery person. He was so sweet to wish me a happy new year as he delivered my meal but the surprise came when he rang again to delivery me a gift of a HUGE bag of Ghirardelli chocolates with a sweet note from all the staff. I think I may have ordered from them once or twice in the last few years so I was by no means a regular but I am most certainly going to be. Not only was my food delicious, I was brought to tears by this generous act of kindness. I will be definitely be bringing friends and family here. Thank you so much for your sweet gesture and you will  definitely be getting a lot of business from myself, friends, and family.
author: Ashley B.

description: Spring roll w pork is too die for!!!!! Pad Thai was just ok. Not a fan of the sweet and sour chicken
author: Holly H.

description:
This is honestly the best Thai Pumpkin Curry I have ever had.
I keep trying to order something different but I can't help but get the pumpkin every time.
I have not eaten in yet, mostly opt for delivery (always faster than the predicted time). I picked up in the restaurant once and it appeared inviting and the staff at very nice.
The fried calamari is delish, I have also enjoyed the satay and prawn rolls.
Pad Thai is lovely, green curry tasty, and to finish with the sticky sweet rice and mango is a treat.
Oh, and they will make the curry to order mild, medium or hot.
So happy this place is in my neighbourhood :)
author: Kat C.

description: Love the grilled shrimp with beans. Tasty! Also like the corn cakes and tod mun. Good quality food for the price.
author: Cherry S.

description:
INCREDIBLE Thai food. SRI Thai is better than Marni Thai for sure.

I lived in San Francisco for four years and did not find a better Thai place. The service is fantastic (I was a regular, every time I came in with my roommates/boyfriend/parents they knew our order including drinks. Nothing is too much trouble for them, and they really make you feel appreciated as a guest in their restaurant.

Some of the best dishes are: the crispy chicken fried rice, the spicy fried noodles, the lemongrass soup, and the woon sen soup. 

I ate here for family visits, birthdays, graduation dinner, etc,...

Arguably the best Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Alex F.

description: Great food and service. Only downside (for me) is the location. We ordered the vegetarian fresh rolls, green bean salad, and pad gra prow and all were great. Wish I lived closer.
author: Janelle F.

description:
The food was very good and the service was really good as well.
I definetly recommend this place.
I won't give suggestions for the food other that saying I tried new things and tried what my friends had ordered and loved it all.
Ok I'll say my mango with sticky sweet rice was outstanding! Prices were very good to portion sizes. :)
author: Nancy N.

description: Amazing Thai food. My family went here tonight and had some of the best Thai. We got the chicken fried rice, curry chicken and spring rolls. Everything tasted awesome. I highly recommend this place.
author: Richard J.

description:
the tom yum soup was a bit too sour, i can make this soup 2000xs better at home. it should be fresh, with lime and fresh lime leaves and vegetables. the mushrooms and prawn were over cooked, like its been sitting in the broth for a few days. you can tell by how worn the spice was.

the tofu prad kow was pretty spot on to what id get in thailand.

need to try more things to get an accurate picture, but was alright. nice that they do delivery so close to outer sunset.
author: Ann L.

description: Love this place. It's my go to for Thai. I always do pick up or delivery because I live close. Great curry -- the pumpkin one especially.
author: LT B.

description: pad thai is horrible. delivery took an hour. sorry, i won't be coming back.
author: None o.

description:
This was a perfect place to go after a long day of walking and museum going. It was apparently "hot" in SF  everyone was in shorts, but at barely 70 I was cold!

Sri thai's TomKaYum soup hit the spot. It has a really tasty vegetable broth. Both of our dishes, while not especially spicy even though they were marked as such, we're verrrrrry tasty. The portions were bg enough for leftover which will definitely make my colleagues jealous. 

I'll be back.... Though this time with a jacket.
author: Kim C.

description: This is another one of our favourites to order delivery from (thanks Eat24!). We tend to stick with our staples which include the Tom-Yum Soup, Combo-Appetizers, and Pumpkin Curry. We've tried a variety of different dishes and they've all been great.
author: Shauna S.

description: I am a Thai food snob, and this fit the bill.  Wonderful food, excellent service.  A++++. All this and very affordable!
author: Joe R.

description: I haven't ordered delivery here and that seems like what most of the bad reviews are about. I live super close so I always walk in and order take out. I love their Pad Thai, Tom Kha and Tom Yum, Spicy Garlic Wings, and the Papaya salad was good but I expected it to have some different ingredients or something more to it, but it was delicious especially with the sweet ginger dressing. They always give me hot tea at night when I walk in and it's cold out. Also they are just so sweet and friendly. Even if I move away I will still come here!
author: Skye J.

description:
The food here was pretty tasty but the service was pretty bad. The servers never came by to refill our waters, and when we were finally able to flag one down, it took at least 10 minutes for them to come by with the pitcher of water. We also had to ask twice for take-out boxes. Probably won't be coming back.

For the record, the Pumpkin Curry was delicious and so was the Pad Thai. If it weren't for the service, I would return.
author: Marycathry V.

description: Such good food, fast service, and great Thai iced tea!!
author: Veronica C.

description:
This place is situated alongside Golden Gate Park in the Sunset Neighborhood and is built around a duplex and apartment complex. Please don't judge a book by its cover because this place is as AUTHENTIC as Thai food can get in the area! 

The staff is dressed in traditional attire and their hospitality is tremendously genuine! All the waitresses are patient, so please return the favor! It might be hard for you to understand them because English is their second language, so be nice!

Their Chicken Pad Thai is YUM! and their Curry is to die for! So much FLAVOR! especially the next day for take out.  

My Favorite dishes at Sri Thai:

YELLOW CURRY
in coconut milk w/ potato, carrot and onion.

MAS SAMUN CURRY
in coconut milk w/ tamarind sauce roasted peanut, potato, carrot.

SPICY FRIED SNAPPER
Deep-fried snapper fillet; topped w/ spicy red curry sauce, green bean, onions, bell pepper, and sweet basil.

PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE
egg, raisin, cashew nut, onion.

THAI ICED TEA!
author: Oliver D.

description:
Terrible customer service and delivery times. 

Food took over 2hrs to arrive, no apologies and multiple lies about where the driver was (few blocks away, 10 minutes away, any minute now)
author: Chris L.

description: Great service and delicious meal! We had pumpkin curry, steamed rice, pad Thai, Tom kha soup with shrimp, spring rolls, and fried banana and coconut ice cream to finish. We are definitely coming back. And taking a take out menu!
author: Elyse C.

description: Best Thai food in the city, hands down. Tom Kha Gai that's so good it makes me want to cry!
author: Sandi S.

description: we love sri thai! its a regular staple in our house- tom kha soup and the garlic pepper tofu! the service is great when you dine in and the delivery is super fast when you order!
author: Nicole N.

description: Great delivery for the price. Not the the absolute best Pad Thai I've ever had, but a solid dish.
author: Amy G.

description: Sri Thai is one of those places that I always hope has an abundance of local customers. I get takeout here occasionally and the staff is always soo friendly. They are really quick and the food is awesome. I love the pad see ew, veggie green curry, and veggie spring rolls. The inside of this place looks like a cozy beach cottage, with a really calm, laid back vibe. I am really impressed and will continue to come back.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Ordered online an hour and a half ago. Estimated delivery was 40min. Tried to call at an hour and no one answered the phone. Called again at an hour and a half and was hung up on twice. Never received our food. Very hungry and disappointed. And it's my birthday :(
author: Cortney c.

description: This review is only for the delivery side of the experience. Just got my food delivered a few minutes ago, delivery speed was...alright, I suppose. The egg roles were questionably small, I almost mistook the "portion" of sticky rice in the order for a random piece of tinfoil that had fallen in the bag, and I paid $13 for a duck dish that had no duck. It had a flap of the skin you'd expect on a piece of duck; the rest of the container was baby corn and green peas. That would be fantastic...if I had ordered baby corn and green peas. But I didn't, I ordered duck. Unless...maybe duck is Thai for baby corn? :|
author: Casey B.

description:
When I lived 2 blocks from here I used to go here all the time. The price is awesome. The food is amazing. The duck and calamari are the best I have ever had. The little rose straw covers are cute. The visit Thailand video they always have going is entertaining in its own way. 

The food makes up for anything negative which may be the size which cannot be helped and the decor.

I recommend this place to everyone I know who visits the city.
author: Krizia E.

description:
My Favorite Thai Place ever! Not only is the food amazing and fairly priced but the service is awesome as well. I accidentally left my wallet behind and didn't realize I had actually lost it until 3 days later. Once I remembered the last time I saw it I quickly called Sri Thai and they made me aware they found my wallet. I Quickly jumped in my car and raced over. I was surprised to see all my money/cards and even gift certificates were still there and untouched. Try the stuffed Mushrooms for an appetizer. 

THANK YOU SRI THAI FOR BEING AWESOME! 

Aaron
author: Aaron B.

description:
I'd give this place 5 stars for the first and last meal I've had here (one sit-down and one take-out), but it's the two in between that give me cause for pause (one of each as well). The food seems to be really inconsistent, but when you get them on a good day, Sri Thai is fantastic.

Most recently we ordered delivery and got the pumpkin curry, pad prik kring, and pad se-ew. Everything was so flavorful, with each dish bringing something very different flavorwise to the table. The green beans were perfectly cooked, the meat and sauce wasn't too oily, and the veggies were fresh and delicious. Wow.

Also, the people working there have always been really nice!
author: Carly G.

description: Sri , has rapidly gone downhill ! Watery Tom Kai gai had no flavor or ingredients, curry dishes were made with frozen peas and carrots . So Dissapointed in what has happened to the quality of their once great food !
author: roger c.

description: I've ordered from Sri Thai 3-4 times before and it was always quick and good. It seemed to be the same on Sunday when four of us ordered delivery. The order was correct and showed up on time. The food tasted good as usual. Unfortunately though I woke up about 3am with stomach pains and spent the next 20 minutes in the bathroom with food poisoning. When I was done my boyfriend was already waiting for the bathroom with the same problem. We both were up all night after that unfortunately. In the morning we spoke to our two other friends and found out they both had been up all night with food poisoning as well. As this was the only meal the four of us had together there's no doubt the food from Sri was the cause. I will not be ordering from them again.
author: Dan B.

description: Sri Thai is good, but small portions, especially skimpy on meat. Still looking for a good Thai restaurant.
author: E F.

description: I found Sri Thai by chance, just browsing GrubHub for a Thai restaurant within delivery range of my girlfriend's house. The food there is SO DELICIOUS that it is now a regular choice. It was a big hit with all her friends, too. I have been called on THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS (by THREE SEPARATE FRIENDS of hers), asking where I usually order my Thai food from, as they like it so much. If that's not a good sign, I don't know what is! Try the Pad Prik King (this is everyones favorite dish her place) or any of their lovely curries. You can't go wrong. A hidden gem!
author: Eric H.

description: Sri Thai is far out there but it was worth the trip. Don't go out of your way but if you do find yourself in the area you wont be disappointed.
author: Ben G.

description:
I have yet to find better Coconut Soup (Thom Ka) with Chicken anywhere in the city, out of, perhaps, 10-12 thai places I've tried here. If you are in Northwest SF, do yourself a favor and pop in. The decor is (what I imagine to be) Thai authentic, the atmosphere is quiet, and I love the garb the servers where.

The yellow curry here is also delicious. I have not been disappointed by any dish here. Be careful crossing Lincoln.
author: Farrell W.

description:
Been passing by here for awhile now and finally went in to check it out. Had dinner with my gf and we were both pleasantly surprised. Very friendly staff and a comfy setting. We had grilled chicken, pineapple fried rice, and  a chicken curry dish with brown rice.  Everything was simple and delicious. Not overly seasoned or overly decorated.  The coconut ice cream was
delicious too!  Now we have a nice local spot to hit for Thai. They also have free delivery!
author: Cyrex G.

description:
I ordered Tom Kha soup, Mas Sumun curry, rice, and a Thai ice tea...delivery

Strike 1: They brought me tom yum soup...not tom kha

Strike 2: There wasn't much chicken in the mas sumun curry, mostly just curry (I hate it when they do this..what am I gonna filled with eating a bunch of liquid curry sauce?), and the taste of the curry itself was uninspiring 

Strike 3, your out: Half way waiting for my delivery, I realized I forgot to specifically tell them to seperate the ice cold Thai ice tea and the hot foods! This worried me because another  time when I had a cold I ordered from a Thai restaurant and they brought me warm sprite and  warmish soup because they put the two together in a bag. I feared if one Thai restaurant did this, then their minds must all think (or not think) alike.

Sure enough, the Thai ice tea was brought to me in the same bag as the soup, which resulted in Thai (not ice) tea, and warmish soup, not to mention as mentioned earlier it was the wrong soup! *FACE PALM*

now I wasn't in the mood to argue or anything.....it was too late so there was no point, but I felt like giving a comment so perhaps someone else wouldnt have to suffer the same shitty result..so upon noticing this, I quietly and gently said to the delivery man "Hm, I wish you didn't put the ice tea in the same bag as the hot soup"

The guy did exactly this:

upon hearing me, he stopped for a second and looked off into the distance, not towards me, but more like towards the horizon. What went on in this guys lil mind in those 2 seconds i'll never know, but he thought of something, perhaps something totally irrelevant like "oh I can't wait for American Idol tonight", and then turned his back to me and continued walking to his car.


WTF? asshole...
author: Belito L.

description:
I love this place. I eat here several times a month. They make amazing regional dishes, the staff are soooo nice and I can walk there whenever I want. The prawn rolls are my current favorite, but I also love the pad see ew and the woon sen soup. 
I highly recommend them. Very highly. Go now.
author: Michele D.

description: After learning to love the madness that is Marnee Thai, I moved closer to Ocean Beach. Sri Thai is a pleasant walk from my house, and I'm so glad! The Tom Kha soup is delicious, the fried chicken wings with garlic sauce is devine. They try to pay attention to details - the little straw paper roses of the iced tea were adorable. The Pad See Yew was hot and tasty. Perfect place to grab dinner after a day at the beach.
author: Marisa R.

description:
I would have rated this a 3 because their pad see ew was ok, but it was cold on delivery. Not a little warm and bearable but just cold. I suspect it was sitting next to a cold drink or something cold for the hour and a half that it took to drive 1.3 miles to my place. 

A run in the microwave for 5 minutes and the food came out ok (just ok). 

Overall, you could take it or leave it.
author: Chris D.

description: Wonderful food, great atmosphere and fantastic service. Hidden gem in the outer Sunset. Pad Thai is perfect along with a host of other of their dishes. Has a real authentic taste and those who are from Thailand agree.
author: Marc W.

description: We chose this place mainly because we happened to be nearby around dinnertime, but it turned out to be one of the best picks of our whole trip -- every dish was tasty, the ambience was comfortable but not snooty, and the prices uncharacteristically reasonable for San Francisco.
author: Ken A.

description:
Was tonight an off night? Maybe the normal cook was on holiday? The meal was bad enough that I'm not inclined to give them another try. 

Tom kha gai had sort of a sweetness to it and no galangal flavor. The fish cakes were super salty and the texture was a little off. The "vegetarian salad" consisted of iceberg, cucumbers, pale tomato and tofu with a peanut sauce. With fresher ingredients it might have been ok.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: I absolutely LOVE the food here. I could eat here every day. Gourmet thai food, great service, and it's SO affordable.
author: Feliz L.

description:
Since moving to the Outer Sunset, I've made a point of visiting local neighborhood restaurants as much as possible. I've had both the pleasure and misfortune to eat at Sri Thai, several times.

First let me say, that the service is always friendly. I feel completely welcomed when I'm in this cozy nook. However friendliness does not make up for, lack of experience or ability to judiciously guide diners.

I am not an expert on Thai food, and unfortunately, the people who have served me at Sri Thai, are fairly non-commital about their menu. Seeming to need direction from their diners, they most often nod and smile at my questions, and can rarely offer anything of substance in regards to menu suggestions.

The food is hit or miss.
Pumpking Curry - Very Good, though there is an issue with their coconut milk. (see below)
Their 'vegetarion' Thai Samosas are absolutely exceptional! I order them everytime I've gone in. Crispy, light and delicious.

Beverage choices are lacking - no Green Tea? Seriously?
Black Tea is too bitter for me and Thai Tea to sweet.

Then there's the coconut milk.
I love Tom-Kha, as well as most Curries, but there is something off with their coconut milk. It has a thick, almost gluey mouth feel, that leaves me slightly repulsed. It tastes fine, but for some reason, my brain interprets that texture as 'Gone Off', and I cannot enjoy the dish.
I had hoped it was a one time thing, but each time I've ordered something with coconut milk, I get the same effect.
I have no idea if it's the product, or possibly the cooking method - but it makes any dish containing it, unplatable for me.

On top of that, there is the price. Frankly, just too high for Thai.

Certainly not the worst food, or dining experience I've ever endured - far from it. But with the plethora of Thai choices (see later review) there is no reason for me to return to Sri Thai.
author: Timothy M.

description:
Their decorations are authentic Thai, and the waitresses are dressed in traditional Thai dresses. 

Everything else goes downhill from there. 

The waitresses are not very friendly. The food is average. 

But it is close to home, and that earned Sri Thai it's 4th star.
author: Jane N.

description:
Food is good.  Flavorful.  Spicy.  

And just nice service too.  Nice sit-down place.  Quality is great!   Good appetizers, nice curries, great noodles.  Good portions.

Prices are good, and what you'd expect for Thai.

Parking is okay for this area.

Although, it was a good reward to bike here for dinner and back.  :-)
author: Fannie S.

description:
Perhaps they were having an off night, but Sri Thai is unworthy of a 4 star yelp review. The service was quick and friendly, and the restaurant was cozy and clean. But all the ambiance cant make up for bad food. Fresh rolls were bland and flavorless. The pineapple fried rice was burned and tasted cheap. The shrimp pad thai was DOUSED in a vinegar sauce that was hardly edible.

Cheap eats, but much better to be had just a short drive up Lincoln or Irving.

I'd pass on Sri Thai.
author: Dave N.

description:
The food here should not be eaten in public, but luckily, I wasn't shy that day.

Delicious.

Anyone who gave less than 5 stars must be insane--I'm just saying.

They must be siding w either heaven or hell. whichever one, we decided that we were on their side

The whole time, we were just talking about the food and floating in and out of consciousness (in a good way)

some more things we agreed upon:

-we are going to move next door

-we are going to be homeless in ggpark and just work all day making money just to eat here

-aphrodisiac to the max

-do not drive immediately after consumption

some more things, some appropriate, most not, but, like i said, i was drifting in and out of consciousness
author: Diane S.

description: This is my favorite Thai food in the Sunset. I always get the Pumpkin Curry with fresh rolls.
author: Dan H.

description:
The Tom Kha is addicting, like crack. Not that I would know anything about smoking crack. The cravings start, and I always get delivery, usually unable to wait until I actually get home after work to put in an order.
 Tom Kha was my gateway soup. I am now also fully hooked on the red curry. I don't even bother to put it in a bowl anymore. I just rip the bag open on the counter, consume Tom Kha, Red Curry, Tom Kha, Red Curry...while my roommate looks on in amazement, knowing full well not to ask me to try a bite. I used to order the personal cup sizes, but now I've gone full blown to the two large containers.
author: Ali G.

description:
My boyfriend and I just got done exploring the Cal academy of science and were driving around looking for a place to eat, when I found this place on my yelp app for my phone. We both love Thai food, and were excited to try some place new. 
I think it has a nice warm cozy atmosphere, and the servers seemed very friendly. They were just a little bit slow on coming to take our order, but maybe we just decide faster than the norm. 
I ordered the yellow curry with tofu and asked them to make it on the spicy side. It was delicious!! I loved the fried tofu! It was awesome how they added broccoli and bell peppers along with the normal onions, carrots and potatoes. 
Overall it was an great place to eat, and I was extremely satisfied.
author: Rachael B.

description:
never been to this restaurant. just having a cyber relationship for right now with sri thai; ordered delivery through from application 'eat24.com' in the comp & they arrive around 1 hour after i ordered, it's pretty cool, nothing that we did too sexy  & expensive though. 
i had samosas, they're vegetarian. they're sexy, yum.
i also had the fresh rice rolls without the egg. they're ok, kinda chewy maybe because it's too long in delivery.
request was vegan and the samosas might has egg in it, because my palate will itch when it's not pure vegan. i also ate the salad provided with a lil mayo in it, and that might cause my itch, there's egg probably in the mayo, next time i have to be careful before i order. If you're real deal vegan, make sure you check first. i'm such a veggie brat, sometimes lazy to check and got the itch! :p oh my bad.
author: Ms C.

description:
The food here is so good, but the delivery service is so bad. I tried to order food on the phone for delivery service. First off, the lady on the phone didn't know what delivery service was. She obviously was just learning english because I could understand maybe 1/4th of what she said (and I am very good at understanding people through thick accents.) 
     It took her, no exaggeration, 7 minutes to figure out my address after repeating it to her about 15 times and having it repeated back to me completely wrong. Then it took er another 5 minutes to figure out what my order was. 
     Basically, I felt like I was responsible for her taking my order right instead of the other way around (which is a sign of really bad restaurant service.)
author: Laura H.

description:
Excellent Thai food at reasonable prices, but listen to me.......come here.......get closer......closer.......no, closer.......ok, that's close enough.

Do not walk out of this restaurant without trying the pineapple fried rice, AND ........ you MUST order the fried mango with sweet sticky rice for dessert. I cannot emphasize this enough. Don't question me. Just do it.

Loved the decor inside and service was outstanding.
author: Rory O.

description: This place is pretty darn good. Prices are fair. Staff are really nice. Food is really good! I recommend the Pa-Naeng Curry with chicken (or without!) and Pad Thai (again with chicken)... The thai iced teas are good. Not the best, ever, but still darn good. :)
author: Lindsey S.

description:
I ordered from Sri Thai a few days ago for the first time, and I'm ordering 
from there again tonight, and I figure they deserve a review for that alone.  

I ordered:
beef salad
pumpkin curry (added potatoes)
thai iced tea
side of steamed rice

and everything was delicious!  Not to mention my order arrived within 20 minutes of my ordering.  I also must mention it took me an hour to decide on the place to order after I hungoveredly searched yelp and various menus of delivery in the sunset area.

I could not have been more happy with my choice.  The beef in the salad had great flavor and texture, the curry was spicy (but not too much) the chicken was tender, and the vegetables were just great!  The thai iced tea was the perfect amount of sweetness to pull the whole meal together and relieve me from a major hangover...and I blacked out on the bar floor the night previous...went to work...got sent home because it was so slow...rode a bus that wreaked of Chinese food for nearly and hour...and hid away in my dungeon-like room only to come out to answer the door for my food.

After eating, I slept for 8 hours and was able to drink a few more beers with the roomies...so thank you Sri Thai (and Yelp) for saving me from one of the worst hangovers I have ever had.
author: Shonna G.

description: Really nice place! Authentic Thai food and friendly services! I have been in Thailand 3 times within one last year and I bet that Sri Thai cuisine is absolutely compatible to the one of decent local cafes of Thailand! Highly recommended!
author: Aliya Z.

description:
Sri Thai is this cute, chill place right next to the beach in the outer sunset. The place is clean and clean, and the staff is friendly. A nice, quiet place for either a date or a relaxed evening with friends.

We started off with the Tom Kha soup (w/ tofu) - very flavorful, with a great balance of tartness from the lemongrass and richness from the coconut milk! We then had the pumpkin curry (w/ tofu) and pad thai (w/ chicken). The pumpkin curry was delicious - like the soup, all the ingredients tasted fresh and made to order; there were distinct textures and tastes in every bite (as opposed to a nasty mush).

On the other hand, the pad thai was pretty disappointing. The thin noodles were too overcooked for my liking, the sauce was too much on the sweet side, and the chicken was dry and un-marinated. Pretty big disappointment.

We ended the meal with fried banana w/ ice cream, which was good but nothing special.

All in all, a good neighborhood Thai restaurant that's worth going back to!
author: Steve L.

description:
Mango Sticky Rice is the best. A little too pricey though. 

Green curry was great. Wish there was more meat though.

Excellent service. Nice genuinely friendly peoples. 

Definitely recommend! Hidden gem of Sunset.
author: Aron L.

description:
05.18.10

I have to admit it's kind of weird when you're one of the only patrons of a restaurant.  Especially when I didn't expect it.

You would think servers would be more attentive, but I felt like an ugly stepchild casted aside to the corner.

The tom-kha soup was really, really good.  Creamy, full of flavor, lots of mushrooms and shrimp.

The pineapple fried rice was excellent as well.  I almost wished I had been the one who suggested that dish.

Instead, I wanted the spicy fried noodles.  Except it was spicy.  And didn't look fried.  I think they gave me pad thai instead.  Fun times...

Will give it another try if I'm ever by the beach, but definitely not worth the drive out for...
author: Jenny L.

description: I was craving Thai and wanted to try a new place. Using yelp I decided to eat at Sri Thai. The service deserved recognition for sure, hence the 2 star, however I wouldn't return here simply because I have experienced much better else where. The chicken was very dry and hard. As if sitting under a warm light for hours. It had no flavor at all. My crazing for Thai wasn't even satisfied. I read a few reviews on yelp prior to deciding to eat here and based on what I read I thought I'd be blown away. Didn't happen, nor will I be happening here again unfortunately.
author: Ish A.

description: Ok I need to minus a star. I was starving and called them exactly at 5pm to order for delivery. Pad See Ew with beef and Pineapple Fried Rice. The delivery was super fast, very happy about that! My Pad See Ew was soggy and the portion size was really small, what was that about? The beef tasted kinda weird, I wasn't sure if it was spoiled or just bad quality meat. There were pieces I literally chewed 30 times because it was so tough! And some pieces just tasted funny, hmm...I'll find out later tonight if I get sick. The Chicken Pineapple Fried Rice was average. Kinda bummed, haven't been there in a while I wonder if they changed cooks or owner.
author: Karen T.

description: Their food is great, they are incredibly polite. They really care about the food and the delivery is ultra-fast.
author: Amber S.

description:
Green curry is amazing.  Yes.  I think theyve found the perfect blend of sweetnness, creaminess, spicyness, and savory flavor.  It could be a little more spicy, but thats ok.  The taste is really really good.  And they give a lot, there was a ton of chicken in it, you could split it with someone, and its only like $7 or something.  

The thai samosas are bomb.  Also got the fried rice, and theres too much stuff in it for me (i like my fried rice with a lot of rice and less other stuff, I wanna taste the rice and get that chewy texture).  I kinda knew that going in with thai fried rices, but ordered it anyway.  The flavor is good, but again, just way too much veggies and stuff for me.
author: Sage S.

description: I do quite a bit of delivery and my options are usually...Chinese, Sushi, Indian or Thai. I have a few choice Thai places in my area for delivery but trying one new is always A CHANCE. I love this place because they always have really great specials.  I also love that the menu is huge. The Spicy Basil Eggplant is awesome.  But my personal favorite is the coconut soup! I am excited to keep trying new items!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
This is really the oddest place to have a Thai restaurant.  We have driven by there gazillion of times but have never tried it. Finally, we went there for dinner.  

We got there a bit before 7p and got seated right away.  Then within 20 minutes, the entire place filled up.  I was curious whether these people lived around the neighborhood or were they visitors living in the nearby Great Highway Inn (?)  They seem to appear out of nowhere, and into this place that is really in the middle of nowhere.

We ordered a Fried Rice, Green Curry, and the Ribs.  The ribs were quite good, although oily and fatty.   They gave us 5 huge pieces, which for $10 is a great price.  The green curry and the fried rice were both good.  I love Mango Sticky Rice for dessert, but they sold out and did not have for the evening, which was quite a bummer.  We ended up with the fried banana ice cream instead.

Overall, not bad.  Service was good.  Decor was decent.  Food was OK.  Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either.  It's close to our house and is another Thai restauarnt alternative to King of Thai on Taraval.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
YUM! Sri Thai gets my vote for Thai food in the outer sunset!! 

Way too much good stuff to mention it all, but the Pumpkin Curry and Thai Samosas appear in my dreams regularly..SOOOO GOOOD!
Don't forget to try the chicken wings ..tangy spicy sweet mmmmmmmmmmm

The staff is very friendly and helpful, (even the delivery folks) and the atmosphere is comfortable in jeans/Tshirt OR something appropriate for a night on the town.
author: Moocifer M.

description:
My husband and I came here last year for dinner one night on our honeymoon. It was nice and pretty romantic. 
l loved the red curry!! YUM!
I don't drink alcohol, so they let us bring out own non-alcoholic wine in. The only reason they don't get all 5 stars is because we still had to paid a corking fee even though it was alcohol-free. 
We will likely be back this weekend for our 1 year anniversary :-)
author: Kelly S.

description:
It's 2 blocks from Ocean Beach.  The food is delicious, and doesn't cost a mint.  The straw wrappers are twisted into teeny little roses!

Great dishes:  the spicy noodles, the spicy chicken fried rice(!!!), and the kra pow gai.  

Good dish:  the paenang.  Service was good, too.  Overall, for the price (approx. $15/person) and the location, a great experience, one I look forward to repeating some time.
author: Kevin G.

description:
I really like this place. A great local spot to go! I came here with friends so I got a chance to try different things. This is what we ordered:

Yellow Curry: Can't go wrong with this. Love it!
Roasted Duck: Had a wierd "gamey" smell to it. Not so much
Eggplant salad, yummy
Pad thai, gooood
We ordered a soup as well but I can't seem to remember which one.

The place is cozy and parking is ample  along Lincoln. If you love Thai, you need to go here! You can also take a walk down to the ocean after your meal. Good date idea!

Love,

Denise
author: Denise C.

description: Really nice little Thai place. I got the pumpkin curry and was really pleased with it. Perfectly spiced and tasted great! It's probably one of the better Thai curries I've had. Decent prices and good service.
author: Junel S.

description:
The food is so good...I eat here at least once a week. This is my very favorite restaurant.

The staff are very attentive. The restaurant is clean, warmly lit and always relaxing. And the best part, the food is great. I haven't had everything, but I'm working on it. However, I keep returning to the Pad Himipan Chicken and the Spicy Basil Crispy Duck.

Normally, their spicy dishes are not too hot. But if you do like things a bit hotter, Sri will accommodate. You may have to convince them that you really want it hot, and if you do, the Himipan Chicken is excellent hot!

I think I've ordered all the appetizers and I can't decide which is my favorite. If you like corn cakes, you'll love these. You can't go wrong with the Thai Samosa either.

If you're feeling like something a little lighter, their salads and soups are perfect. The Tom Kha is delicious and the Papaya Salad is amazing.

If you feel like trying something new, but can't decide, try something from their specials menu. Sri changes their specials monthly (approximately). Some things are available longer, but they always offer something new.

It's easy to eat too much and forget about dessert. If you can save room, the fried banana with ice cream is magical. And so is the mango sticky rice. My wife and I debate as to which is better.
author: Christopher B.

description: I don't know about the service, but the food here is definitely good! I love their green curry, and now I'm HOOKED! It's definitely good and the theres always a good amount of veg with a balance of whatever protein you choose. Not only is the green curry is good, the pad thai is just as great! I had pad thai before but their pad thai is doesn't stick together like King of Thai. I also had their crispy chicken fried rice, although it wasn't the best. i still prefer it over the main chain restaurant flavoring. I've gone back to order delivery several times already and each time it doesn't get old, IT GETS better!! one of the better thai places in SF definitely!
author: Amy T.

description: Lovvvve this place....I'm addicted. Crispy chicken fried rice is unbelievable. Thai iced tea is perfect. Love all of their different types of curry as well. Try the corn cakes too, served with a delicious slaw.
author: Christine H.

description:
After being referred to come here by Jerry W. for the longest time, tonight the moon and the stars have finally aligned for me check it out.  

I've eaten at a whole bunch of Thai restaurants in the city including restaurants in Thailand and this place is probably ranked amongst the top 5 in the city.  I've come to realize that we are very fortunate to live in such a diverse city.  I have tasted some of the best Thai, Italian, Chinese, French, Mexican all here in San Francisco.  You really don't need to go to far to get good ethnic foods.  On the other hand, some of the best fast food joints are better in other countries.............weird....if you really think about it.

This place is in the middle of no where.  If I was never given the address or the name, I would probably never have come here...........NEVER!!!  The place from the exterior looks like a dump.  The interior is a little better.  They have a big monitor that constantly shows scenic areas of Thailand.  The servers are dressed in their native attires.  I asked myself...........the food better shine!!!

We had

Fried spring rolls........this is as authentic as it's going to get.  it comes with a side of salad topped with mayo(which i didn't care for) and the sauce

Tom Yum Chicken.....This is probably their best dish here.  I hate it when Thai restaurants leave in the lemon grass roots and you have to take them out yourself.  They don't do that here.  It's a very clean soup......especially on a cold night.  They only open for dinner.

Green curry duck......One of their weaker dishes.  Sauce was a little too watery and the flavor wasn't all there.

Pork with basil, garlic, and peppers was very good.........if they only minced the pork......this would be awesome.

pad thai................... typical, average dish.

51.00

On a side note.............why are there so many 2 buck chucks here?!?

Overall, a restaurant worth coming to.
author: jason g.

description: I don't usually like Thai food, but decided to give this place a try through Livingsocial. I was happily surprised to find their food delicious. Personally, I really enjoyed the chicken satay, the pad se ew and the samosas. And, their customer service is exceptional. Though they messed up one of my orders (I ordered a salad with no prawns and they delivered it with prawns), I called them and the lady who picked up the phone was very helpful. She offered to redeliver the salad or give us credit for the future. I asked her to contact Livingsocial and refund my credit card, which I realize was more complicated, but she did it anyways and I received my credit less than half an hour later. Good food, good service, 5 stars!!
author: Svetlana K.

description:
Great foods and services!  I ordered the Papaya Salad and Pad Thai for delivery and first time receiving exceptional delivery service in the city.

The Papaya Salad is awesome and have the right flavor for the salad.  The Pad Thai is the best I have tasted in the Sunset district.  I am going to try out the restaurant with some buddies in the near future.
author: T C.

description:
My family orders at least once a week from Sri Thai.  In fact we get Christmas cards from them...  Been eating here for at least seven years.  Our standard favorites are the Pad Himapan Chicken or shrimp.  Tried this dish at other thai places and nobody makes it like them.  Everyone else just does a quick stir fry with cashews but this place batters the chicken/shrimp so they have a slightly crunchy texture.  Love it!   Sadly, over the years the portion sizes have gone down, but alas, nobody makes it like them!

Can't go wrong with their pad thai, and the YUMMY samosas made with sweet potatos.  If I could only get their recipe!  My four year old loves the samosas.  When I'm sick I usually order their Wo Sen soup (its a clear broth with noodles, tofu, veggies)   

My husband has been addicted to their satay for years, but we stopped ordering it when we realized the grilled chicken entree was basically the same thing (not on a stick of course) but you get a larger portion for a little bit more money.  You just need to have some peanut sauce to go with it.

Excellent fast service!
author: Regina V.

description: Had the spicy fried snapper and veggie fried rice.  Both were really good and the fried rice was pretty healthful, chock full of broccoli etc.  Recommended!
author: Daniel L.

description: Been there three times now in about a month.  Excellent tofu pumpkin curry!!!
author: Briar S.

description:
What a combination of dishes this place not only presents, but the variation of tastes and texture is awesome.  As the saying may go, places like these are a hit or miss.  From the number of stars, which is hardly the case in my sense, this is a hit...you sank my battleship hit.  The ambiance which really doesn't catch my fancy nowadays was good.  My back was faced the entirety of the place, but what I saw was cool.  Right across from Golden Gate Park, plenty of parking (got there around 8pm on a weekday), and the place was more than half packed.  Then you think, do Yelp reviews help restaurants...HECK YAH, it got me there, I hope you read this and say, I gotta try too!  

As for the food, we ordered three dishes.  
1) Fried Chicken Fried Rice...awesome.  Don't be deceived, it comes with little katsu-type chicken on top.  
2) Grilled Chicken...great without the sauce, awesome with the sauce.
3) Pad Thai (Pork)...tasty, cooked well, and lots of it.  

This is one of the places that you drive by and know you want to try, but you just never go.  Well, there you go.
author: Joey H.

description:
Great Thai restaurant in the sunset.  I used their online ordering system which is very convenient and my food arrived 20 minutes.  

I ordered chicken pad thai for the first time here last time and it was delicious.  My favorite is the chicken pra ram (chicken with steamed vegetables and peanut sauce).

Other great menu items:
Appetizer -- Angel Wings
Salmon and eggplant **
Fried Chicken over fried rice with sweet and sour sauce on the side (too many carbs though...would eat this everyday if I didnt care about getting fat).

They are very friendly and the delivery guy is always really nice to my husband (always remembers his name).  

They sent us a Christmas card one year too!
author: Sheila S.

description:
Very attentive service, friendly staff, and great food that is always consistent. I love their fried banana one cream, chicken skewers with peanut sauce, Tom yum soup with prawns, pad sew eww noodles with vegetables, grilled chicken,and a grilled snapper dish with vegetables (# 75 on the menu). I also love their prawn rolls as an appetizer, and many other dishes. 

The atmosphere is very positive and I always feel welcome when I come in here. They are very polite and I never feel rushed. They even make a little rose for you out of paper that once covered the straw. It ends up being a nice little touch , but it is those minor touches that make a difference. 

I love this place!
author: Emily G.

description: Great spot for yummy Thai food! I suggest eating there because it's really charming and staff is great. My favorites are the pineapple friend rice, pad pak, cashew nut chicken, and crispy chicken fried rice.
author: Alice F.

description: One of the tastiest Thai places I've been in a long time.  Looking forward to returning!
author: vanessa e.

description:
I was so disappointed  with the food . I came all the way from San Jose to try this restaurant, bcause I saw that the review was great. First of all,the place was dingy the smell was musky. The corn fritters that I ordered was hard and dry. It seemed like it was an old fritter that was just re fried. The deep fried stuff mushroom was hard again and had no taste.
Then comes the crispy duck. Why was it called crispy? Because it was old and dry again,  then deep fried ,poured with the sauce.
I wonder what kind of palette do these people have that gave this rest.a five star. I would not recommend this restaurant to people who have high 
Expectation.
author: Maria W.

description: If I could afford to eat out every night this is where you would find me.  The food is spectacular, the ambiance is cozy, and the service is great at this outer sunset restaurant.  They also offer convenient delivery service, which you can do all online.  Forget any negative vibes from other yelpers. this place rocks!
author: Grace O.

description:
I went back here recently.  Since I last reviewed this restaurant I've eaten at several other Thai places in SF and actually gone to Thailand.  Now I think the food here is just meh.  They don't use flavorful spices that you get at a lot of other places in town.  It's not bad food, it's just not great.

Aside from the food, they serve glasses of Charles Shaw (Two Buck Chuck) for $4.  WTF?
author: Daniel H.

description:
I was actually surprised that I liked this place.  I was in the mood for some Thai food after A mentioned (probably not seriously, but he totally put the thought in my head for the rest of the day) that he wanted to snack on some Pad Thai.  So I was really craving some Pad Thai.  We stopped by Marnee Thai on 9th & Irving, but there was a wait and we were hungry so we hopped in the car and came here.  I've seen this place sooo many times, but it doesn't look very attractive from the outside.  It looks a lot better on the inside.  It was actually quite full too.  Just a couple of empty tables - one of which we soon occupied.

Everything was really quick.  I think we had the Pad Broccoli, Spicy Fried Snapper, and Pad Thai.  The broccoli was pretty average for a broccoli dish.  The snapper wasn't spicy at all, so it was actually pretty tasty.  And the Pad Thai was okay.  I was a little hesitant because it was very monocolor when it arrived.  Just very brown and bland looking.  I think the way a dish looks definitely has something to do with how it tastes.
author: Kris L.

description:
tom kha gai and green curry YES YES YES.

pad thai stay away.

adorable thai nook pretty much next door with friendly service to match.

outer sunset do it.
author: Angelina C.

description: Usually when I think of Thai food, I think of the restaurants found downtown that's usually greasy and gives you a food coma after finishing off the meal. No so at Sri. I had the fried rice with fried chicken. Both lacked the greasiness that I usually associate with fried rice or fried chicken, but didn't lack in taste. Nicely breaded, generous portions of chicken breast. I wasn't disappointed at all and was satisfied after the meal. This is the first time I was satisfied with Thai food.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night with reservation that we didn't need. Only a few tables were occupied. Been here once before awhile back but can't remember what we had. This time we ordered:

Fresh Spring rolls- OK/good:  Light on the palate with a tamarind sauce that wasn't too sweet. Fresh veggies but all a bit bland. The sauce made it good.

Chicken Wings - Good! : These were slightly sweet with a kick from the chilli sauce. Not too spicy but I had a recovering sore throat and ate a few anyway because they were so good. Skin was still crisp, chicken was moist and fully cooked through and fried basil for garnish was yum.

Pineapple Fried Rice w/chicken - Good!: Rice was a bit mushy/soft but not in a gross way. Just not what I'm used to with fried rice. Big chunks of pineapple. Flavorful. My favorite dish of the night.

Pad Thai w/shrimp - OK: Noodles were a little lacking in flavor. Not enough spices and although it was great for my now damaged from chicken wings throat, it could have had a bit more of the sauce since it seemed a little dry.

Pad Se Ew w/beef - OK: I liked this better than the pad thai but again the noodles seemed to lack any flavor. The veggies were cooked perfectly, not overdone or too hard.

I came with a friend who normally doesn't like Thai food because of all the spices so needless to say she loved everything I didn't. 

Overall: 3.5* if I could give them that. They tend to skimp on the meat with all dishes but service was good. They didn't come over too often to pester us but not so often that we'd stare at our water glasses hoping they'd magically refill. My fault for chugging it after the first chicken wing though. Portions are smaller than  what you'd get at most restaurants but at the same price. 

I'll come back again only because it's the only Thai place good enough within walking distance from my house and I dont each much anyway so the small portions might be less wasteful for me as I dont like taking leftovers home.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Smells like poo poo outside...

The place looks 10000000000x nicer on the inside than it does on the outside.
Cleanliness - 100% who doesnt like that?

Food was all very sweet, which I like very much. Because I have a sweet tooth~ Even the hot and spicy thai soup was sweet.  My sister in law probably wouldve died.

They use cashews instead of peanuts which thai places usually use. So even peanut allergic-ers can enjoy thai food here!

They show like tourist spots or sights of Thailand on the big screen tv, which i thought was a waste of a tv...

Over all, good food and good service.  Nice job.
Must Tries- in order from best to 2nd best
1. Lamb curry
2. Rainbow salad (mango dressing salad!!!)
3. Samosas
author: kim w.

description: easily the best thai food made and delivered with love and care. this is my new go to for delivery nights!!!! all their curries come perfectly seasoned and packed with carefully portioned, fresh veggies. pad thai is excellent as well! very good, 5 stars!!
author: Libra J.

description: Best Thai in the city! I live closeby and get an order at least once a week! Must get: Green curry with Chicken and EXTRA eggplant (the eggplant is to die for) or the Spicy fried noodle with Chicken. Staff is beyond friendly as well!
author: Samantha N.

description:
This is an unusual place. I love their food and it is very reasonably priced. Chicken Satay is superb with some pretty damn amazing peanut sauce. My fave dish is Pad Se Ew. Simple, clean, flavorful. Get it with the pork. 

Here's the thing though.....

Get the food delivered. I love the food, but the service is slow and often confused. I once spent over 30 minutes waiting for the check. They deliver all over the Sunset and they are SUPER nice people. They sent us a Christmas Card one year. How cool is that? 

Again, nice people, GREAT food, but get delivery or takeout. If service were more professional, they'd be a 5 star joint!
author: Jon B.

description: Very reasonable prices. The portion size was surprisingly good, but not overwhelming. The food was flavorful and well balanced, though as a chili-head, it was a little mild for me. The waitress was polite and attentive.  Overall it was a good experience, and I would recommend this restaurant.  I will be back myself.
author: Scott P.

description:
Went to Sri Thai again this past Saturday night with friends. Food was delicious!

I had the crispy chicken dish. Yummy! Much better than the other chicken dishes. Crispy chicken has more flavor and texture. 

I also had the corn cakes. Very tasty and crunchy, really crunchy!

They are made with whole kernels of corn and not corn meal or corn flour. 

And so far my favorite is all the pumpkin dishes they serve. Pumpkin dumplings for appetizer and various pumpkin curry dishes. 

Red snapper dishes are good too! Choice of brown rice or jasmine rice is offered. Try the Thai hot tea without any milk or sugar. It is really good. I found it very satisfying and soothing, especially in cold weather. 

Sri Thai gets busy and place can get filled up fast. So calling in for reservations are recommended.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I haven't had much thai food I've been to india so I know indian curries but this place is legit as far as I know!

tasty red curry and the green curry is my JAM! too good!

the chicken was a little fatty but definitely edible and tasty.
author: Anthony T.

description: It's hard to overstate how awesome it is that this place is not only consistent but consistently excellent. In the 3-4 years I've ordered from them several times a month I've never caught them on a bad day -- and consider that 90% of the time I order delivery rather than eat there in person. Sri Thai = Made of Awesome.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Sri Thai has the best thai food for the prices and it is only a block away from me. The only downside to this place is that they don't deliver, but they make up for it by taking phone orders at 9:30 PM. Now that's what I call stellar service.

Their veggie spring rolls are so yummy. Their pad thai is yummy. All of their curries are yummy. Pretty much EVERYTHING on the menu is yummy. I've started trying new and different dishes that I would never try if I was paying a higher price at a fancier restaurant.

The waitresses are always so so so kind. I love Sri Thai.
author: Catherine H.

description:
I don't know how I ever lived without Thai delivery.   Sri Thai is a few blocks from my house, but I've never been there...  Sometimes I just LOVE not leaving the house.  

Yay:

ordering online- so easy
good soups
good curries
everything always tastes really fresh

eh:

unimpressed with the apps I've had...  And I'm one of those people who likes to make a meal out of small dishes.

When I stick with soup and curry, I am never disappointed, and so happy to be have delicious food brought to my door!
author: mona r.

description: The food is typically good, but I ordered vegetarian spicy noodles tonight. I'm a vegetarian with a shellfish allergy. I had prawns in my food, which I realized after I took a bite. I returned to the restaurant, and the staff did not apologize once. They acted rude. It was very difficult to get the managers name, I'm not sure if they understood me. I won't be returning, and I hope I don't have a reaction, or they will be hearing from me. Fingers crossed.
author: Liz U.

description:
I went on yelp looking for a thai place that has good curry and sticky rice in my neighborhood. I went to a couple of other places before I found this little place. It was not the highest rated place but i think it should be. I dont know much about thai food but I like to get some curry with sticky rice every now and again. All the other curries in the neighborhood where watery and that special something in the flavor was missing. You know, that special something that makes you want to savor every last drop of the curry, not just eat what is in it and leave the sauce.

This place was not 100% for me, so I am out on the hunt for the perfect curry again. If you know of a place hit me up.
author: howard h.

description:
Maybe I'm kind of a thai food snob.  I could seriously eat thai food every night of the week without getting sick of it.  Sri Thai just didn't do it for me.

Props for their location right near da beach - I was on my way to a bonfire last night that I could walk to from here.  We started with their rainbow salad which looked yummy as stated on the menu.  When it arrived the flavoring was just....off.  Too much fruit combined with tomatoes and a weird tangy sauce? I just wasn't into it and my tummy didn't like it either.  Same game for the Pad Thai.  Too much weird flavor and not enough of that certain je ne sais quoi (how do you say that in thai?).  

Nice staff and the service was OK if a little slow.  Sadly they didn't win this thai food freak over.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Me and my friend stop by here since she love Thai food and we were in th City. Read a lot of good reviews so we decided to give this place a try. Place is not hard to find, just off of Lincoln near Ocean Beach. It's an average size with decor to make it feel quite cozy. 

We saw a lot of people recommended the Tom Yum with chicken, so we order that soup for starter. Then we order Pow Gra Prow with chicken and tamarind Duck. The Tom Yum was quite sour, there wasn't no spice to it. Suppose to be spicy and sour but we both tasted the sourness. The Pow Gra Prow chicken was quite bland, once again not spicy. The Tamarind Duck was the only one that tasted decent. You can't go wrong with roasted duck, but the sauce make the roasted duck easy to eat without getting sick of it. 

The service was pretty good, they came by to refill our water and ask for what we need. They even scoop the rice into little bowl for us in the beginning. We came to a conclusion that this Thai restaurant cater to American people. There was no chop sticks on the utensil set, the food was plain and not spicy. You seriously can't eat Thai food without it being spicy or else it wouldn't taste good. There's too many other places out there and I wouldn't come back here again.
author: Thanh T.

description: Delivery through grubhub arrived later than predicted. We ordered the pad see ew, tom ka gai and mango with sticky rice- it was all gross. Not just bad but gross. Greasy beyond belief, nothing tasted fresh and the sticky rice was way over cooked and attached to the paper container it came it. With all the good thai in the city they'll be no second try for you.
author: Brandi M.

description:
This has a family atmosphere but not the only-Mama can cook and she is not here tonight feeling. I.e., the food was fresh and professionally prepared. The servers were more on the family style but what they lost in efficiency they made up in friendliness. I can't wait to go back.
PS
My Japanese mother-in-law usually hates other Asian foods but she loved this place....
author: Chou K.

description:
I have nothing but love for Sri Thai.  Their portions are great, their food is delicious and their staff is very attentive.

My favorite dishes are the Pad Himipan, the spring rolls, the thai samosas (anything that they make with pumpkin is delicious), the crispy chicken rice (although I recommend you get the crispy chicken in everything bc holy crap it's that good), Tom-Kha soup and the spicy fried snapper is awesome.  Their Thai iced teas are fantastic, but after two I get a bit shaky.  I can't really handle caffeine.

My favorite part?  It's off the beaten path, so eight times out of ten I usually enjoy an awesome quiet meal with my boyfriend and friends, just sort of watching each other stuff our faces.  This place is always consistent.

PS - Get the fried banana with ice cream and roll yourself home!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I have to say that this place is pretty good.  

When we drove up to the place and I remember telling the bf that you cannot judge a place by the outside and I am still sticking to my guns on this. 

We ordered our food to go from their awesome website.  We had the spicy fat noodles and some pumpkin curry.  The Curry was AMAZING.  That was so good.  I am salivating as I think about it.  It as nice and creamy with tender chunks of pumpkin... so good!  The noodles had a really good taste, not as spicy as I wanted it to be but still yummy non the less.  

I am starting to wonder if all noodles get sticky in transit?  They were still really good so I can over look that.

Good price+ good food = repeat visits
author: Jennifer S.

description:
The rainbow salad was great. The samosas were really small and just ok. I wouldn't order them again.

I found the pad prik king ok but there were way too many green beans and not enough chicken or bell peppers. I wouldn't order this again. 

The pad himapan was excellent - very flavorful with the crispy chicken. Yummy. Ordering it togo isn't nearly as good though.

The pla jien was cooked perfectly - it was good, not excellent.

The spicy fried noodles weren't spicy enough!!!! The flavor was good but where's the spice?

The pad se ew was good but pretty average.

The grilled chicken was good, it was very tender and had nice flavor.

This place is tiny inside. Overall pretty good. Friendly service and consistent quality.
author: Chili B.

description:
This place rocks!  I've taken several dates here and it is the place for something sophisticated yet frugal at the same time. 

I don't know of any other Thai restaurant within walking distance of this area that has Thai food of such good quality along with the nice quiet intimate atmosphere so you can talk to your guests!

I can't say anything negative about them to be honest, and the only reason I don't give them 5-stars is because there's probably better food out there if you pay more, but this place has it all working for them!
author: Rob L.

description:
Portions are plentiful and prices are extremely reasonable. The food is fresh and yummy. 

We ordered:
Shrimp Salad:  plenty of shrimp ... would have liked more cabbage and other veggies

Yellow Curry with Prawns:  Huge portion that included a green bell pepper or two (though that's not on the menu and I am not a fan of bell peppers); the curry is sweet, just the way I like it. 

Pad Gra Prow with chicken breast:  Very large portion. I did not eat, but my dining partner liked the light garlic taste, plentiful portion, and combination of the dish in general

Thai Iced Tea:  Always a fan, but would have liked more tea and less cream.
author: Carrie S.

description:
The service was excellent--prompt water refills, friendly staff--but the food was average at best.  I'm never fond of the use of iceberg lettuce for salads and especially an entree, like the Pra ram, when I go for Thai.  The samosas were also a bit undercooked.  

With its location way out in the Sunset, I see it as a decent place to hit after a romp at the beach.  But with a couple of other Thai restaurants in the area, it's at least secondary to Cottage Thai a few blocks over.  Sri is fine as a neighborhood joint, but it's hardly a destination restaurant.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Really good Thai food in an unlikely location. Take a chance on this lonely place - great food for the most part. It's not perfect - the spicy dishes could be spicier. Some dishes way too salty (maybe MSG?) some way too sugary. Overall really good though.
author: Bill W.

description: A bit on the sweet side although I have to admit, I just got back from a visit to Thailand, not spicy enough and overload of brown sugar and coconut milk. the tom ka was so thick i thought it was curry.
author: Tiff W.

description: Absolutely the blandest most Americanized fakeThai food I've ever had. Lettuce and tomato in the green papaya salad. Bland brown gravy on the snapper. No spice. When we asked for hot sauce, they brought us Chinese Sambal -- nothing the least bit Thai about it. Anybody who wrote a positive review of this place has never had real Thai food. Idiots.
author: Angela R.

description:
I ordered a pad see ew rather than the usual pad thai.
$7.50 for a small plate of that. And the fact that it wasn't a lot, wasn't worth it.
For choice of meat, I had chicken which was bland and dry..thank goodness for the water!
I think what saved the dish was the noodles.
Anyways, after the main course, my friend and I ordered the deep friend bananas with coconut ice cream. SOOO GOOD!
Well, maybe it's because I love anything fried. Lol.
So overall, pad see ew = okay, dessert = great!
Service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Horrible.. it took forever, but they only had two people there.
They forgot my sparkling water but it's okay, not a big deal. The person who took our order didn't seem so friendly when I asked her for napkins. I wasn't being rude at all..
If you live nearby or in the area, would I suggest this? No. My mom doesn't like the food there and she's been there multiple times and stopped going.
I've heard great things about King of Thai, but they have 3 stars on yelp, and here has 4... ? 
I don't think I'd want to come back there unless it was the only thai place open nearby.
 ++ They open late btw!
author: Jae T.

description:
Found this place on Yelp...didn't even know it existed until I searched for a Thai place in the neighborhood.  It's about a 7 min drive from our house...not too bad.

We went for dinner during the week...they are closed for lunch during the weekdays.

Ordered the Thai Samosa...not worth it.  At this point I was kinda of discouraged.

For dinner we had the Spicy Basil Eggplant, Red Curry with Chicken, Pineapple Fried Rice and Thai Satay....everything was very well cooked with flavor. The did redeem themselves with dinner.

Service is good, nothing to spectacular.

Prices are fair...I like that they are near by...but another 10 min to get to Thai Time and I'm a happy camper!
author: Daddy F.

description:
Sri Thai it is a very good restaurant. In fact in my opinion it
is the best Thai Restaurant in the Sunset. They always open till
10 pm. Highlights for me are: Classic Thai tea, Crispy Chicken Fried Rice and the stick rice with mango. It is worth every penny spend in this 
restaurant.
author: Alex M.

description:
I happened to stumble across this place because they left an advertisement on my friends doorknob.  It has now become my favorite thai restaurant of all time. I keep going back time and time again.  

Other restaurants that I've been to leave an oily after taste, but at  Sri Thai their dishes are fresh and crisp.  My favorite dishes: Tom Yum Soup also the tom kha soup, chicken wing appetizer,  pad thai, Silver Noodles w/ prawns cooked in a clay pot, fried bananas w/ honey or with ice cream. Also be sure to try their thai iced tea on warm days and hot thai tea on cold nights.They're also great for take out on the drive home or delivery if you're in the area.
author: Stacey L.

description:
Alright.  Delivery came super fast, nice driver.  The pork spring rolls were good, but the sauce was sorta lame, too bitter sweet.  The masaman curry was sorta bogus, but way more flavorful than the chicken pad prick.  I ordered everything "extra spicy" and it was like Taco Bell spicy at best.  Bogus to the max.  

I probably won't be trying this place again, unless it's a dire food emergency.  With so many AMAZING restaurants close by, it's just not practical to be eating relatively flavorless, spiceless thai food.
author: Blake C.

description: This is a great place for Thai food, but I like Chabaa's Pad Thai more.
author: Forest S.

description: This place is sooo good!  It's the best Thai I've found in SF.  The ingredients are FRESH - the chicken and eggplant and other vegetables always taste really great.  Everything just seems to taste how it's supposed to.  The green curry is just right.  It's all well-flavored, with good ingredients, and never ever greasy.
author: J N.

description:
The location of this place may be a bit odd.. but I love it! So close to my house, easy parking, never a wait...

I've tried the red & yellow curries, pad thai, samosas, and garlic chicken and all have been fantastic. I also like the ambiance of this place; nicely decorated and you never feel like you're sitting on your neighbor. 

I have had some awkward service, when our bill was split one time it ended up $20 more, but they fixed it.

If you're in the hood, go.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
Excellent Outer Sunset neighborhood Thai Restaurant.  I must confess I haven't eaten in here but have mostly ordered out.  The delivery is fast and friendly.
