The first year I discovered this place I was ordering very often.  I was rewarded come Christmas time with a tin of cookies and a Christmas card delivered with my order.

I would highly recommend the following:  Appetizers:  Corn cake (delicious pancake made of corn kernels mixed in batter and then fried); and the deep fried boneless chicken wings stuffed with ground  shrimp, chicken breast, corn, carrot, mushroom, bamboo shoots and silver noodles.  (One word:  Addictive)

For your salad course I would recommend the papaya salad or the beef salad.  If you'd prefer soup instead, then I would go for the tom kha  with your choice of shrimp, chicken, or tofu.

Main course I would recommend trying the grilled chicken or duck, which is served on a bed of veggies and rice or the grilled salmon.  If you'd prefer a curry, you can't go wrong with any of the curry selections as they have yellow, green, or red curry.  When ordering a curry I usually order the yellow curry chicken or the delicious pumpkin curry.

If you're in the neighborhood then I would highly recommend you stop by the place for some really good Thai food.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Gordon A.

description:
I am a Thai food slut. I love Thai food... really.
Last night my boyfriend and I went to Sri Thai and were impressed by the Green Curry, and disappointed by the Pad Thai. 
My green curry was subtle with spice that didn't hit me off my seat but was gradual and warming with a sweet after taste. The eggplant in the curry was to die for, melt in your mouth and a thousand other food cliches all wrapped into one.
His Pad Thai was less than impressive. He is a strict vegetarian and was put off by the fishy smell that the meal was giving off. The taste was OK but nothing worth trying again. We decided to put some of my curry over it, which improved the dish immensely.
The Thai Ice Tea was very sweet, I think they use half-and-half... mmmm... tasty.

Overall the service was very good, smiling waitress and reasonably quick service. Besides the amazing green curry what really pushed this restaurant into the 4 star category was the interior, the music and the location. 
The interior was very nice, comfortable with enough space between you and the next couple to have good conversation. Wine and two glasses hand next to every table, and good music plays at a background loudness. 
The location is great! I love the outer-sunset, and being only a block off of N line, 3 blocks from the beach and facing GG Park... lots of parking and easy to walk to is all you can ask for in the city.
author: Tre B.

description:
I live up the street. I get hungry for Thai. I walk down the street. I eat. I enjoy.

The staff is always super friendly and the food goes from good to great. Try the Rainbow Salad!
author: Timothy B.

description: Good comfy place to eat. Good service, great portions, and decent prices. The ambience is very nice with almost an Italian feel.
author: Jerad T.

description: Went here last week with my husband for a date and it was perfect.  We wanted yummy food, instant seating, and not too loud so we could actually have a conversation without yelling.  The food came pretty quickly and was light and not too spicy.  The waitresses were all pleasant.  The only thing that i didn't like was the uber-huge television hanging over my husbands head when we sat in the upper balcony part.
author: Onyia P.

description:
Post Bay to Breakers, stumbling up from the finish line and looking for a MUNI ride that wasn't gonna cost me $7, I had the good fortune of stumbling across this little gem.

I sank into a mini Bangkok moment, truly. Everyone there speaks Thai, the day I visited, even Thai families were eating there, always a good sign. The decor is simple but actually pretty authentic - down to the lazy susan condiments with all the right ingredients. I could have been back on the good side of Khao San Road.

I paid $12 including tip and tax for a BIG plate of spicy wide rice noodles with tofu, broccoli and green beans and one Thai iced tea. Lots of vegetables, not too greasy and good spicy (altho' I added more wet chili paste). 

My service was friendly and prompt and the bathroom was very tidy. They also had an interesting vegetarian mango salad on the menu which I was glad I didn't order only bc I was stuffed. Nice range of veggie and meaty, all the classics done right.

If I am ever in the hood again, I will definitely come back for more.
author: Miel H.

description:
Sri Thai is a fantastic, tiny little restaurant in the outer sunset. It serves some of the best Thai food in the city at reasonable prices. And they deliver! I can't even find another one that does. 

Try the Fried Calamari, Pad Thai, and Pad Gra Prow with Chicken. Those are my favorites.
author: Darcy V.

description: Very good Thai food! We always feel at home when we dine here. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming. They always forget to bring condiments, but it is not a big deal, since every other aspect of their service is quite good: fast preparation and fresh ingredients. Their chicken wings are amazing! Crispy, well-prepared. Make sure to try them when you are there.
author: Mary E.

description:
Used Yelp for the first time to determine where we were going to eat.  The others are right.  This place was great!  It's a quaint, local shop in the Outer Sunset area that clearly has regular "locals" coming in for their take-out.  

Thai Samosas were great.  Noodle dishes were equally pleasing.
author: Brian L.

description:
I back packed in Northern Thailand and lived with some of the Mountain Tribes who cooked their food fresh every meal, including harvesting the rice that day, and oh my... This place def reminded me of being in Thailand and traditional northern taste!!
Their veggies are always fresh, and meat even more so!  It's hard to find an Thai resturaunt with such tender and lean meat!  Yes lean!!! 
Must order the Beef Panang Curry,  Tom Kha Soup!!!, or Veggie Fried rice!  The rice is heaven!  (Oh, the salmon, yes, is a little dry)
I've had friends drive down from Tahoe heading to Santa Cruz, and specifically stop off here for dinner!  It doesn't get anybetter than this!  It's hard to get to, but totally worth it!
author: Leslie D.

description: Great neighborhood Thai.  Miang Kum a bit unusual compared to other places, in that it came with hot green peppers instead of lime, but we enjoyed nonetheless.  Excellent green curry.  Brown rice is available.
author: Robert B.

description:
Hands down my favorite place to get vegetarian thai food in San Francisco. I'm able to consistently amaze visitors with this place. Awesome for a date, or just friends. 

I'd like to recommend their Tofu Satay and Pepper Garlic Tofu. I'm not much of a tofu fan in Thai dishes, but they pull it off perfectly in both.
author: Snaker Z.

description: never again. had dinner delivered one night and the pad see ew had somehow gone bad between the time they cooked it and delivered it...
author: Ann T.

description: Service was good, food portions were small considering the prices. Everything was sweeter and richer than what my family was used to (my mom is Thai). I don't know if they just use a lot of coconut milk to make the food creamier so customers feel more satiated... I guess it's just adjusted for the American palate. Like another reviewer said, there wasn't much chicken in one of the curries we ordered. I think I need to visit this place again and try their other items on the menu to get a broader perspective of this establishment.
author: Selina C.

description:
Sri Thai is the happiest restaurant I've ever been to. I don't know how else to describe the vibe in here. This is the friendliest staff I've ever seen, anywhere. They even mailed us a Christmas card last year signed by the entire freakin' restaurant, and we'd only ordered takeout from them once - in August. 

Eat here. They're nice people. Oh, and the food's pretty good too.
author: Nick R.

description: Food was great & atmosphere was nice (haha, very clean large mirrors gave the impression the place was bigger than it was).  had the Mas Samun Curry over rice which was excellent.  Chicken fried rice was and Pad Se Ew were good too...   Thai Ice Tea could have benefited from less ice.
author: Ricky A.

description:
Only ordered from them twice, got it delivered and they made good time.  For two people getting two entrees, appetizer and a side of rice it was $25-29 both times!  Great price for some good food if you ask me!  Really yummy Pad Thai, I got mine with prawns and it was really good, I liked that they took the tails off too.  Chicken Satay is really good and their peanut sauce is awesome, really good on the rice too.

Overall, good price, good delivery if you live in the Sunset, would definitely recommend.  They are all really nice too, will have to go to the restaurant some time!
author: Jessie M.

description:
They do my favorite dishes so well! Pineapple rice = good, tom ka = good, fresh spring rolls = good! Try this place, you will be happy that you did.

Also, the service is always good, the girls that work here are so sweet.
author: Kate M.

description:
This is our default dinner place when at the end of the day we just want good comfort food without the hassle of driving around looking for a good place to eat. We're asians, so any cuisine with rice qualifies as comfort food lol
Seriously, this place has low key elegance and a simply quality that's very soothing. The food is well made with no unnecessary frills. 
They have different specials every now and then and this time we tried the spicy crispy duck with basil and it turned out to be the bomb! fried to a crisp with out  losing the duck flavor and all covered in basil and spices. Like duck chicharon! Needless to say we finished the whole dish and ate more rice than we needed to but i told myself that it was worth it. The pad Prik King with tofu was still yummy but it got overlooked in the end by the novelty of the crispy duck.
Service as always was warm and efficient. And i would recommend you try their jasmine tea - aromatic, flavorful and extremely soothing.
author: Frances G.

description:
Fresh and good tasting food.  Number #67 was a winner (beef with mixed vegetables and peanut sauce).  Can have other protein with that dinner.  Two people are able to eat around $20 (including tax and tip, no drinks).

Played some pub-like birthday music for "happy birthday" patron.  It was fun though.  Not a romantic, quiet place, but a great place to meet with friends to have some good food.

Service slow at refilling water glass.  Noticed that we weren't the only ones that were low on water.

Small space as is common in SF.
author: D S.

description:
I don't know what it is about sitting at home on a cold, rainy, windy bastard of an evening, and sipping some white, creamy, DELISH Tom Kah Pak.  I have done this three weekend nights out of this month, and Sri Thai has never disappointed me once.  

Seems like I always get the same thing, the veggie spring rolls and a soup, so I don't really know how their noodle dishes are, but my friend always seems to enjoy his spicy noodle-y fishy dishes.

They are a little pricey, but c'mon.  They deliver, and the spring rolls are not BOILING hot, they're just the right temp. out of the bag.  It's the little  things, people.
author: Lily E.

description: I live in the outer Sunset and order from Sri Thai quite a bit. I absolutely love their pumpkin curry with vegetables and chicken. Their delivery is always fast and so far I've been able to count on them for yummy food when I don't feel up for cooking at home.
author: danny K.

description: I had to update my review of Sri because it's become such a wonderful and special place to me. My husband and I still go here a couple of times  a week - we have to - we're addicted to some of the dishes. Since my last review, I've had opportunities to try several of their specials and new appetizers. The regular crispy fried snapper is superb, but they recently had a fried snapper dish on their specials that was to die for! And I can't say enough about how wonderful all the people who work there are. Always smiling and pleasant.
author: michelle b.

description:
My buddy and I came out here for a quick dinner before working out. Since Thai food generally isn't too heavy or oily, we figured that we'd be good to go.

The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't impressive. 

Three stars cuz it's worth coming back to if I'm in the area, but not a place I'd be searching out.
author: Robert L.

description: Love the food here.. perfectly satisfies my taste buds! crispy chicken fried rice and grilled chicken, chicken with basil are all my favs!! I live so far away, else I would be here 24x7!!
author: Rashmi K.

description: This place failed to impress me. We ordered delivery one night and decided to try this place over the other local Thai restaurants, mostly because it was the closest one to our house. In retrospect, I would order from somewhere else next time. The food was bland and way too simple. I think my sauce had like three ingredients in it. The delivery person was very indifferent to me despite being 15 minutes late, presumably because I had already tipped him via grub hub. Out of the four items we ordered, none of them tasted as spicy as thai food should be, nor as succulent, nor as fresh. The prices were not particularly high or low, but who cares if the food is kind of mediocre?
author: Alexander W.

description:
Yes:  mussamun curry, peanut sauce, sticky rice (but probably not together, because hey, mussamun is a lot like peanut sauce).

No:  "fresh" rolls -- not good at all. The wrapper tasted a little like styrofoam and the sauce was like honey.  Pad Thai -- soooo sweet, and really not very good.  

It's nice that Sri delivers (even though I only live like 5 blocks away, but I'm lazy).  I would order from them again, but never the Pad Thai.
author: robyn s.

description:
Thai samosas--you've GOT to get them.  Yam, taro, and other veggie goodness fried up and served with that sweet chili sauce that I am addicted to.

Almost everything I've gotten here has been really good, although the dressing that they use for the salads smells really odd to me.  Tastes great, smells weird.

Always awesome: the aforementioned samosas, pumpkin curry (oh harvest-flavored spicy creamy love!), garlic eggplant.

They often have specials, which in the past have never disappointed.  

The restaurant has a really classy (for a Thai place) sitting area--nicely decorated, quality linens and artwork, and they're usually playing some kind of instrumental jazz (not *light* jazz, REAL jazz like Miles Davis or Sonny Rollins or Bird).

Service is usually good.  Great as a take out or eat-in.
author: Jen D.

description:
Been here a couple times, both were times it's been fantastic.  The location is a bit out of the way, but after walking through the park and along the beach, it's the best find ever.

The restaurant is small, but colorful inside and cozy.  The staff is very nice and attentive.  Fast service with a smile, can't go wrong.

We went this weekend and had Tom Yum soup with chicken, Pad Thai with beef, and grilled pork (we love meat).  The soup was AMAZING.  The pieces of chicken were kinda bland, but the broth was very flavorful - sour/sweet and spicy, some of the best tom yum I've ever had.  And plenty of meat and mushrooms.

The pad thai was a little less colorful than other places I've been to, but it was just as good.  Noodles cooked well and flavored just the right amount, served with plenty of egg, sprouts and flavor-soaked tofu.  Lastly the grilled pork!  Sweet and tender, comes with a nice chili sauce, definitely worth a try if you go.  All for less than $30 for two!  Pretty great, will be back and would definitely recommend.
author: Leslie G.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant. You can't go wrong with anything you order from Sri Thai. In my opinion, they have the best curry dishes. The staff is very friendly and prices are reasonable. Plus, you have to like a restaurant that post it's mission statement (by the door). My favorites are the pumpkin curry, pa neang curry, tamarind duck, fresh rolls (with crab meat and veggies) and of course fried bananas. 
"The Best Curry Dishes"
author: Jorge B.

description:
Fantastic Thai food!
Fantastic service!
Fantastic everything! 

I like their curry dishes and noodles. 
Very spicy. 
The wait staff is very, very friendly.
One of the best in the city.
author: Larry J.

description: I eat Thai all the time all over different places and I have to say their food is world class.
author: Joseph K.

description: Not bad  except the Pad Thai portion was too small.  Charge couple of extra dollars if you must and double the portion.  The way it was I need 3 orders just for lunch.  The fish cake was half the portion I usually get in other Thai restaurant.  The green curry was just spicy enough and had lot's of chicken.
author: Raymond C.

description: Its a little place that if you blink you might just miss it, dont blink. The food has alot of flavor and the staff are extremely friendly. The crispy duck and green curry's are a must everytime we go.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
Absolutely phenomenal food. A small little restaurant with excellent attentive service and food with super-reasonable prices ($6-8 per entre plate). A friend of mine says that out of all the Thai food in the city, this is the place.

I had Pra-ram with Chicken (sauted with garlic and topped with peanut sauce), a mild coconut curry with tofu, and delicious eggplant with salmon and tofu on the side. Refreshing Thai iced tea too! Vegetarian friendly.

It's definitely at the far corners of San Francisco, but the good thing is that not many people know about this gem. Take the N-Judah all the way to the end of the outbound line (near the 48th Avenue stop).
author: Steven C.

description:
After driving by AND living one block away from Sri Thai for so many years, I decided to give this place a try in hopes of finding a decent place not in the Inner Sunset.  

We started off with the corn cake - crunchy and good.  Your standard Thai corn cake.  I'm glad we ordered an appetizer as the entrees really took awhile to get to us.

The pumpkin curry on their menu was the decision maker (for taking the first step in) - the actual dish was blah.  It seemed that night we went vegetarian, I added tofu.  Everything but the pumpkin was yummy, the curry sauce was delicious and the tofu was probably the best 'item' in the dish.  The pumpkin tasted a bit strange and not very fresh.

I don't remember what this dish was called, it was on the 'Specials' menu, but it was a seafood (calamari, shrimp, bamboo shoots...) curry.  VERY VERY tastey.  Everything in the curry was fresh tasting and generous pieces of seafood.

The food decent, service was slow (that night), atmosphere very cozy - I would definitely come again with a date, friends, or family.
author: Irene C.

description: It's really expensive for how much they give you. I got the fresh rolls almost no crab meat mostly just the wrap and lettus. I also got the beef salad, the smell is bad and there was barely any lettus. I was expecting a decent sized salad with beef on top but there wasn't even a lot of beef either. I paid 16$ for nothing. I tried to like it but I don't think I'll ever be back.
author: Jessica J.

description: Delicious!  This is my default delivery place.  I would eat here every day if I could afford it.  It is a little on the pricey side, but worth every penny.  I always get the pad gra prow with tofu and thai samosas when I'm getting dinner, and grab veggie spring rolls and mango sticky rice as a snack on my way to the beach.  Delivery and eat in service are always timely, and the people are friendly to boot.
author: sara b.

description: This is a really cozy little spot in the way Outer Sunset.  There's very little in that area, so it's nice to have this place around.  The wait staff is very polite, and I thought the food was real good.  My GF liked the food too, but she promptly ralphed all hers up the second we got home.  Not sure if it was the food itself or just an issue with her, but I tend to think the latter because she ate her leftovers the next day and was fine.  So in my opinion SRI is cleared of any wrong-doing.  I give it 4 stars and she gives it two barf bags.
author: Michael D.

description: I wanted to Thai food last night and found Sri Thai on Yelp...what a disappointment.  My boyfriend and I ordered the Spicy Fried Rice Noodles with Chicken and the Green Curry with Beef to go.  We thought both dishes were sour...not sure if they intentionally made it that way or if we had a bad batch =/   The noodles weren't very tasty and the chicken in it was dry.  However, it was a lot better than the curry.  Even the veggies in the curry didn't seem very fresh (very dull green).  Yea...I don't think I'll be going back.  Thai Time is still my go-to Thai restaurant in the city...
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Very impressed with the service, and with the restaurant itself. I strongly disagree with the reviewers that referred to Sri Thai as a "hole in the wall." The seating is pleasant, as is the decor/mood. They have an awning and landscaping outside, for pete's sake. How can it be a "hole in the wall?"

Unfortunately, I was less impressed with the food itself. I was in a party of three, and my spicy noodles were good, but our table's pad thai was way too sweet, and our yellow curry was also very sugary sweet. 

If I go back I would insist that yes, even though I'm white, I can handle a little spice in my curry. If the dishes were spicier, they would have offset the extreme curry sweetness.

Besides that one (major) issue, no complaints. The ingredients seem fresh and the plates were well put together.
author: Justin D.

description:
Old mangy looking exterior, but really nice service and great food at a very reasonable price. They made a little rose out of the paper on top of the straw in the iced tea--nice touch.
Especially good: grilled tiger prawns (huge and 8 of them--enough for 3 people). Rainbow salad (w/mangos) if you like lime juice (i do)
Not especially good: thai samosas (too greasy). 
Want to go back to try many other dishes.
author: L J.

description: I've been here a couple times, and it was always awesome. I love their samosas. But I really love samosas in general. But when I came here with my family for my mom's birthday, everything was really off. Maybe we came on a bad night, but it kinda sucks cus I told my mom this place was reallllly good. Then during dinner everything is just okay so shes talking smack about everything. That sure ruined the night. But their food is still decent if not great. I won't let one bad experience ruin this place for me :)
author: Christina X.

description: I got food poisoning tonight eating the pumpkin curry. I normally have great experiences at this restaurant but tonight i cannot say the same. The one star is for the fact that i will be sleeping on the toilet bowl until my projectile vomitting comes to an end. Ill never look at pumpkin curry the same.
author: Melissa W.

description: It's about time I gave this place a review, I've been eating there and living around the corner from it for six years. Great food, great service, good prices and an elegant atmosphere. Only Khan Toke tops it in my book.
author: Whit G.

description: Ordered from here again, mostly the same stuff. Delivery was very quick, even with the online order. I'm a fan, and any time I'm in the mood for thai, and too lazy to move or pick up the phone (which is way more often than it should be) I'll continue to go here! I'll try some new stuff next time.
author: Parker H.

description: Not horribly bad, but could use some improvement. Parking always sucks there. Too many mobile hobo camps taking up parking spots on Lincoln makes it rare to find a spot later in the evening after neighbors have come home from work, and have also parked. The curries are a little watered down. The meat you get with an entree is very skimpy especially considering they've significantly upped their prices a few years back. The chicken satay is dry, and tasteless. The soup is a little watered down, and also lacking meat. Fried bananas, and coconut ice cream are very good. I would give it an extra star because it's really the only Thai in the outer sunset that was close to my house, but since I've moved, and can now look back objectively, I can't justify the third star.
author: Cullan S.

description: The food is good, but the serving size is pretty small. The Thai Ice Tea is very sweet. The eggplant has a nice texture and taste really good. The Pat Thai is good, but small. The waitress takes a while to understand what we say, but she's very friendly. They walk around to refill water cups frequently. In the hour and half that I was there, she asked if we were ok, probably four or five times. You know how that can get annoying if they ask too frequently? It wasn't to that point yet, but almost. I thought it was pretty cheap, $90 (tips included) for four entrees and two appetizers.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Came in here to order some quick take out the other day. It is tucked way out on Lincoln and I drove by here a few dozen times and never noticed it. Glad I did because the food was really good. Service was quick and got my takeout within 10 or 15 minutes after ordering.

Some of the better thai food I have had in the city. For sure the best I have had out in the sunset. There is another place on Irving around 25th that I have not been to so I can't compare.
author: jared c.

description:
Grubin, Grubin, Grubin!

good food man. Only Thai place I would recommend in the outer sunset. food is fresh and service is nice. We always get takeout and every time I go in there to pickup the food I'm greeted with friendly soft spoken staff. I also often see bushels of vegetables, pea pods, eggplants being prepared by the kitchen so I know the food is always fresh. definitely try it.
author: Mike Y.

description:
the pumpkin curry--bombbb

service--always do take out, but the ladies on the phone are always really friendly and not so gruff like most asian take out places

affordable and six blocks from my house...doesn't get much better than that :-)
author: Tina D.

description: I am in absolute shock. I had a great week at work (I'm a waitress) and I was ordering take out this evening and decided to give the delivery gentleman a nice tip. My bill ended up being around $25-$30 and I left him a $10 which I didn't think was crazy, especially during the holiday season.  I wish I would have gotten his name but he showed up with my dinner and presented me with a bag of Ghirardelli chocolates and a hand written note from him and their staff. I will definitely be a regular not only because of this EXTREMELY kind gesture but also because their food was absolutely delicious. I will most definitely be bringing and recommending all my family and friends here. Thank you so much again for your wonderful service ( I still so wish I knew his name, it was at about 9pm Sunday December 28th at 45th avenue if that helps at all because he was just so sweet and you should be so grateful to have him on your staff, from one restaurant worker to another.) :)
author: Ashley B.

description: I went here yesterday with my friend and there was a cockroach in my curry. They apologized, but did not comp our meal. It was really gross and I will not be returning.
author: Lindsey H.

description:
So I ordered some food for delivery from Soi Gow on 9th and Judah. When it arrived, I looked at the receipt and it said "Sri Thai Cuisine". I was a little confused, but I'm assuming they're under the same management and Sri Thai is closer to my house for delivery. 

Anyway, I ordered the Pad Eggplant with Tofu and the Fresh Roll with no egg. Food came in about 50 minutes (a little long, but I'm also pretty impatient). Pad Eggplant was delicious! I often get this at Thai places and it's super oily, so I made sure to request light oil. This one was not too oily, the tofu was lightly fried but not greasy, and the peppers and onions were nice and crisp. The Fresh Roll was good, but I would've liked more veggies in it. I got it without egg, so there was lettuce, tofu, cucumber, cilantro, and bean sprouts. It comes with a very good dipping sauce though. All in all, good experience. Good food, good prices...would recommend and will be ordering from here again!
author: Daniele D.

description: I'm not too experienced when it comes to Thai food, but so far Sri Thai is definitely the best I've had so far. My favorite dish is the tofu and peanut sauce.
author: Bam H.

description: I have eaten here a lot.  They are good but sometimes too oily.  That have a nice menu selection and good prices.  I wish their food were more consistently good.  I've had some really amazing meals from here and also some really mediocre meals from here.  Their soups are really good - I always really like their soup.
author: Heather K.

description: Went to dinner with my friends.  Appears everything tasted better than the previous visit.  Had corn cake, fried calamari, tom yum gun soup, pad thai, and thai ice tea.
author: Jer W.

description:
The online ordering system is great! Its easy to order and my food arrived within 20 minutes. So the 4 stars are for the speedy service, and decent food. 

I wouldn't recommend the pad thai with tofu (it was a little bland, and had very little sauce). But the samosas, spring rolls, and spicy fried noodles were pretty good. But if you like things really spicy, then you definitely need to ask for it because the flavors are very subtle (I didn't think the spicy noodles were very spicy at all).
author: Janel A.

description: It's aight if you're in the neighborhood.  Plenty of parking, which is a nice change of pace for this city.
author: Dave S.

description:
dear sri thai,

we order from you several times a week (i know, i know).

your pumpkin curry rocks, and thanks for having brown rice fried rice. not many places have that.

xoxo
sprout

ps) if you order online expect to wait a while, call it in!
author: Sprout S.

description:
I've eaten at a large number of Thai restaurants, both in the US and in Thailand.  

Sri serves the some of the best Thai food in San Francisco.

I recommend the green curry with brown rice.  The brown rice is spectacular.
author: Matt M.

description:
I wouldn't call this place romantic, but it is a very decent neighborhood Thai-restaurant. The service is usually great and very friendly!
My favorite is the crispy chicken dish and all of their curries are tasty, too. I cannot recommend the seafood, though. The salmon was a little dry and the mixed seafood dish with calamari was chewy. If you live in the area: it's the perfect place on a Monday-Thursday evening when you are not in the mood to cook!
author: Iphigenie S.

description:
Cozy hole-in-the-wall thai near Ocean Beach!
Good service, casual,  and YUMMY!
the rainbow salad and the yellow curry chicken are seriously out of this world. The pumpkin curry is too! Try their ice tea if you are down to drop a few more dollars.
Seriously reliable thai...thank the lord. oh yea.. they deliver.
author: Allison And Joshua H.

description: quick delivery. duck overly fatty. actually so fatty.. i refuse to finish it. pork spring rolls good, needs better sauce. pricey.
author: Abigail W.

description: Good food with a cozy atmosphere for a cheap price.  We ordered the pumpkin curry and the yellow curry chicken, both with sticky rice.  We also shared some prawn spring rolls and a few Singha beers.  The prawn spring rolls were okay but I couldn't get enough of the pumpkin curry.  That was good. Parking was no problem either with it being right next to the park and Ocean Beach.  Tucked away on a little corner of the city.
author: Lyn D.

description: My very favorite Thai restaurant.  I have been going here for years and the food is delicious.  The servers are so kind and attentive.  The food is always sauced (is that a word?) just right - not too explosive or overly bombarded with spices.  I love the quiet, peaceful ambiance and the prices are just right.
author: Marie Y.

description: Very good Thai food. Cute little place. Right by ocean beach, and even after a beautiful beach day they were not crowded, they also deliver for free! Great Tom Yum, good green curry.
author: Amanda D.

description:
sawatdii kha!!! dichan khun Grace!  dichan chob Sri Thai raan aahaan maak!

-geng khiaw wan (green curry) is good... they even make it with eggplant!  i love eggplant!

-pad see ew is just okay.  

-beef ribs are finger-lickin', suck the bone dry, good.

-very attentive service.

their tom kha gai (sour coconut soup with galangga, lemon grass, and chicken) is so comforting and delicious, I want to make a blanket out of the soup so I can wrap it around myself for snuggling on a foggy San Francisco day/afternoon/evening.
author: Grace M.

description: We live down the street from here and come here almost every other week for their great Green Curry and Chicken Satay!!
author: Evelyn V.

description: Don't rate this place until you try the Pad Himapan with Crispy Chicken.  It's fantastic.  The service is always great, this is an outer sunset gem.
author: Dan S.

description: While at the beach one day I became hungry and went in search of food. This place oddly enough popped up two blocks away.The food was great. Service was fast and friendly. I would drive all the way out there any day for the curry or other great dishes.
author: Nick C.

description: My absolute favorite Thai place in the City. When I left SF after 18 years this was at the top of my list of things I knew I'd miss, and I do - whenever I'm in town or blowing through it, I stop here. The Pad Himapan with chicken is to die for. Nicest servers, ever. A best kept secret for those of us proud to be westsiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiide.
author: Cake M.

description:
So I LOVE the food here. Especially the curries and the brown rice...well actually everything I tried was really good. 

However I can only give this place 3 stars because twice now they have not boxed up all of our leftovers.  I don't understand why they won't give us all of our food! Do they box half of it and throw the other half out? Or god forbid do they reuse it? I know for certain that they don't give us all of our food because each time we've come here, we over ordered and I only ate a couple bites of the side of rice and the curry dish.  We asked them to box the rest of it up and both times they gave us about half of what we had left!! It's not that they lack the proper container size, because they've boxed up other items in bigger containers.  Basically, It took two visits here, but next time we will only order what we can eat while being there...even though next day left over thai is always tempting...but I'm going to come back again because like I said I love the food...and well the $14 bottle of 2 buck chuck is just funny.
author: Sonya D.

description: We discovered this little gem after the first flickr mixr I attended. At first glance, I thought, "geez, check out this hole in a wall" but boy was I wrong when we entered the restaurant. The employees were highly respectful and the food...oh the food! I was impressed.  I ordered the Pineapple fried rice to play it safe, but it was more than I expected. Decent amount of prawns (not just 2 or 3) and the rice was evenly flavored. I tried a friend's pad thai which was good and the spring rolls were delicious as well.
author: Maricel B.

description: Cute little place with a relaxed ambiance and great food. We loved the pumpkin curry and tamarind duck, and their peanut sauce is just scrumptious. Servers were pleasant, and the prices were reasonable (about $8-9/dish). They even offer free deliveries on orders $15+, and you get free fried bananas with honey, too. On orders $25+, you get free spring rolls. This place is perfect for a lazy night in.
author: Lillian L.

description:
this place was an awesome little find. the pad thai was pretty good, slightly on the sweet side. unfortunately, the portion size was a little disappointing (not that everything has to live up to claim jumper - ew!) but half the dish was the actual pad thai and the other half was a quarter bean sprouts, carrots, and cabbage and a quarter pile of crushed peanuts. my boy ordered the spicy fried noodles (sorry - not sure if the "fried" is in the title, but it's listed 2 under the pad thai) and was soooo happy. he comes from boston/D.C. and has been looking for "drunken noodles" ever since. he claimed that this dish was exactly it and moaned over its goodness.

we also started with a veggie fried spring roll appetizer, which came with this yummy peanut-covered sweet sauce and small cabbage pile with mayo dressing. all in all, a good yummy experience. the food came pretty quickly and the drink service was frequent and prompt. AND they deliver - woo hoo!!! there's a $15 minimum order for free delivery though. no problems there. :)
author: Kristina Y.

description: I finally tried this place after passing by it almost every day while looking for parking. We came here on Saturday night with a party of three and were seated right away. The staff was very nice and helpful, food came out fast which was important because we were starving. I got the tom kha soup with chicken, yellow curry with tofu, and fried banana ice cream. The soup was great, creamy and flavorful, I think next time I'll get it with shrimp though. The yellow curry was alright, not bad, not the best, definitely very edible. And the dessert was obviously delicious! How can it not be!
author: Tatyana K.

description:
The menu is all in English.

I've eaten here several times before. the food was good then but not so good this time. Two of three dishes I ordered were way, awfully, too sweet. The third was Papaya Salad that lacked spice and lime. 

I think if you want real Thai Style cooking you have to ask for it. That was my mistake. Otherwise you get a hand full of sugar in your food and no heat.

They should have paid the old cook better, I guess. 

It would be worth the effort to travel downtown for good Thai food.

I also want to add: There was a nice travel video playing while I was waiting for my take out. Unfortunately the host of the travel video was a highly publicized child molester.
author: d s.

description:
What a cut place. I had dinner here with a couple of girlfriends. You really wouldn't know this place existed, if you didn't drive by it. It's kind of out of place for such a good restaurant. 
We stared out with appetizers, the stuffed chicken wings. They were good, but I have had better. We also had the daily special appetizer, forgot what it was called, but it was a mixture of shrimp, onions and peanuts on a little lettuce leaf with a sweet dipping sauce. That was tasty. We ordered the pad thai, which was nothing to brag about. I have had better at other thai restaurants. We also ordered yellow curry with chicken. I usually don't eat curry, but I thought the curry here, was decent. We also had the deep fried spicy snapper. The fried batter was a bit chewy, which kind of threw me off a bit. Besides the texture of the fish, the taste of it was good. All in all the food was average, but the service was great. The wait staff made sure that our glasses were never empty and that we received everything that we needed. 
I give the food a 3 stars and service 4 stars!
author: carebear l.

description:
After a good day of surfing or just after work.  This place is amazing.  I swear by it.  The food is so fresh, the veggies, fish, or whatever maybe your fancy.  This place maybe out in the cuts, but it's worth the drive parking is very accessible walk/public transport hop it's that good.  
It is a little hole in the wall, but that adds to the character.  Try it out, I highly recommend the rainbow salad and fried spicy snapper (ask for it extra spicy if you like spicy food)
author: John C.

description:
I hate to admit it but this place has been slipping for the last several years. It used to be my favorite restaurant in the city. I haven't been there in months. 

Portions have gradually gotten smaller to a point where I get angry every time I get an order delivered. Most people that haven't been going there for years probably overlook this. I remember the portions being much much bigger. 

The taste has also gone down. The curry is now very watery. From the best in the city to just average curry. I make better curry now.

Also, I used to like it because it was a nice and quite place to go on a date. A few months ago, I had to wait an hour to get in. 

I miss the old restaurant! I miss O and Boy!!
author: ljuba s.

description: yummy Thai selections in a outer Sunset hidden location. a pleasant appetizer special today was the shrimp lettuce cups with roasted peanuts, minced ginger, lime juice, basil, garlic, with plum sauce. the Tamarind duck was pleasantly savory and not too spicy or tart. Pad se-ew is also a good dish here with sweet soy and egg. and for the vegan, curry pumpkin! it's listed in the menu as red curry, but for the mild curry fans you can special order the pumpkin with yellow (mellow) curry. I'm glad I finally checked out this spot after driving by it so many times.
author: Jeff W.

description: I LOVE the Tom-Kha soup!  Sweet, light, and sooo good.  Try it. I order entrees as a side to the soup. The cup size is large enough for two cups, the bowl for 2 big bowls.
author: Ken M.

description:
this is like my favorite hole in the wall. there's usually only a table or two being served inside around dinner time. so it's quiet, clean and food is delicious. you can order take out online now too..

the papaya salad is refreshing and their green curry is excellent!
author: sasa w.

description:
I live pretty close to this place and pass by it often. It looks kinda of sketchy from the outside, but I wanted to give it a shot since I was craving green curry. 
My friend and I went in for an early dinner around 5pm on saturday. The place was completely empty so I thought it would be pretty fast and attentive service. We ordered right away, green curry, pad eggplant, and thai iced tea. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time, but they brought out the wrong thing. I asked the waiter if this was pad eggplant and he looked at me and said something else (couldn't understand). And then he took it away. I felt bad that I guess he didn't understand me the first time, but I didn't want what was brought out. 
The curry tasted alright, my friend noted the colorlessness of the curry, stating "it's not very green". The pad eggplant was cooked well but was  bit bland and could have used some more seasoning. 
Me and my friend's water didn't get refilled except at the end of the dinner when they brought the check and only after my friend pushed the glass to the edge of the table. 
Not super attentive, food was mediocre. I probably won't come back here again, even though it's close to home.
author: Christine Y.

description: We come here from time to time, but last night was awesome! The dishes were especially tasty and the portions this time around were HUGE!  We ordered Calamari, Larb Gai, and Green Curry with prawns, figuring we could order more later, but the portions were so large we couldn't finish. The larb was delicious with lots of chicken and the curry was creamy rich and tasted so good, but filled us up so much we had to take the rest to go. The prices were about the same as other Thai places, but since you leave completely stuffed it turned out to be a really good deal.
author: china s.

description: I haven't been to the actual restaurant location, so I can't comment on the atmosphere, cleanliness, etc.  We ordered delivery from here for six people and everything we ordered was really tasty.  The pumpkin curry was perfect - the pumpkin was soft but not mushy and just the right amount of spice.  The other notable item was the fresh spring rolls - very fresh, although more like a sushi roll wrapped in rice noodle than the vietnamese version.  They forgot the rice with our delivery, but quickly returned with rice, free sodas for everyone, and a sincere apology.  I'd order from them again.
author: Amy C.

description: I love this place, my BF and I found it many years ago, and never I have been disappointed of their food, ambiance, or service.... love their thai tea!
author: Karina W.

description: I don't speak Thai.  In fact, I'm a total bozo when it comes to asian food restaurants because I can never remember what I had so I can't be all that useful when it comes to making recommendations.  The food I put in my mouth here tasted good.  Some of it was flat noodles with garlic, tofu, peppers, and basil.  Some of it was orange with chunks of chicken, pumpkin, and rice.  Would I drive all the way to this place for Thai food if I didn't live a few blocks away?  No.  Then again, there is no Thai food place I'd go out of my way for.  If you are deep in the Sunset, this place is worth swinging by for a bite to eat.
author: Curtis H.

description: Wonderful restaurant with tasty food and some of the happiest people on earth. The staffs are always smiley and courteous. I love their beef salad, eggplant salad, tom yum soup, woon sen soup, pumpkin curry, fried rice, and their weekly specials. Some dishes are very authentic Thai but most are somewhat Americanized. If you want your dish to be "authentic" then just ask. But be careful when you ask for "spicier"... The prices are very reasonable for the quality food and service.
author: Quynh I.

description:
Don't waste any time reading this review, just go and place an order!

I've only ordered delivery, so I can't comment on the atmosphere at the actual restaurant.  But oh my effing god, I love their stuff.

The delivery guy seems nice and sincere and real, and has always (about six times we've ordered) gotten the food here quickly and still very hot.

What, you're still reading?
author: GreatAlfredini J.

description: I read the reviews tonight before finally making a long over due visit to Sri Thai. My experiences were somewhat similar: busy, kind of slow on getting water and keeping it refilled.. but you know what? I didn't care. the atmosphere is great, yes, there is jazz music playing, and the food was amazing. I'm super picky with Thai food; and the tod mun, prawn satay appetizers totally hit the spot. Definite plus! Especially if you live in the outer sunset, as on Sundays, Thai Cottage is closed ;)
author: j d.

description: This place has one of the best pad thai's I've tasted. The green curry is also very good. I've only gone here once, but it certainly lives up to all the good ratings it's raked in. The portions are huge and the price is right. I'm definitely coming back the next time I crave thai.
author: Tracy P.

description: Mediocre on pretty much every level. I feel a little bad giving a two-star rating, but the reality is I've had better Thai food in many different restaurants. Sri is a pleasant enough place to get dinner, nothing special and no frills. The food was pretty blah. The pad see-ew, my touchstone Thai dish, was conspicuously lacking an egg presence and the sauce was too sweet. Yellow curry and pad thai were boring. To be fair, their green curry was very tasty: if you end up here, stick with that. Service was slow and somewhat awkward.
author: Kathleen B.

description: I ordered take out tonight (pad thai) and it was absolutely wonderful.  I'm completely stuffed since I couldn't stop eating, even though I was full.  I'll eat there again for sure.
author: Leah M.

description: Big surprise! They are as authentic a Thai restaurant as I have found in the city. They will comply with your request to make it HOT. The papaya salad will blow your scalp smooth off. They have sticky rice, not only as a desert but as a starch to the main course. The last time I ate at a Thai restaurant that served sticky rice with their food was over 15 years ago in Hawaii. I am a big fan of Massaman curry and theirs is awesome. Will be back.
author: Greg S.

description: I ordered the Pad Thai and my friend got Curry with Beef.  They were both just OKAY; nothing special about them.  The Pad Thai was a little mushy, but the pork that I ordered with it was good.  The curry was a bit watery, and the herbs were a bit over powering; the beef was a bit chewy, but it was all still edible.  Service was friendly enough and food came out in a timely matter.
author: Long H.

description: It only took me six months to discover this hidden little gem. Nestled in the outer sunset, my husband and I stumbled upon this place after walking home one Sunday afternoon because we had missed the bus. We saw this place and decided to give it a shot and we loved it! The prices are reasonable, the environment is quiet and peaceful and the food is great! I highly recommend it!
author: Marilyn W.

description: I have to say that I've eaten a lot of thai in my life.  I may not have been to a million Thai restaurants, but of the twenty or so I've patroned I've gone a lot and eaten the shit out of the menu.  In my honest opinion, Sri thai is the second best thai place I've ever eaten at (1 is Thai Tom's in Seattle).  The food here is so damn good I can't stop eating it.  The pumpkin is amazing as is the pad prik king and himapan and the pad se-ew and the spicy fried noodle and... Plus they deliver and the prices are fairly cheap.  Sure the pad thai may not be the best ever but then again, where is it ever the best ever.  Pad thai is often eaten, rarely perfected.  So Sri gets five stars
author: David V.

description: My hands down favorite thai restaurant in the city.  Just finished my dinner from there and knew I had to spread the word about this hidden gem.  My  usuals are red curry w/ shrimp or chicken, tom kha w/ chicken, and pad himapan.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
this place has never let me down.  from the papaya salad, pumpkin curry, or the grilled salmon...sri thai has got it goin on!!!
living on the edge of the sunset, our options are somewhat limited, so having great thai spot a phone call away is sooooo convenient!!
yummmmy
author: K K.

description: This is a reliably great Thai restaurant.  All the standards, pad Thai, Tom Ka Gai, green papaya salad, and various curries are just as Thai food should be.  The kabocha squash with fresh plump prawns is especially good.  Sri Thai is often full.  The service is competent and gracious; the atmosphere is fine.
author: Laura C.

description: 3.5 stars, really. This place is always packed for some bloody reason, so I am typically forced to call ahead for take-out. The food is really yummy, but I wouldn't say it's more yummy than other Thai places at which I've eaten, so I don't really get why people rave about it so much. If you're here, and it's packed, keep in mind there's also a place on Judah @ 46th about 2 blocks away that's just as tasty (no, I don't work for them). Sri Thai is good at having things fresh and hot, so if you're looking for consistent thai food, go here. Just plan to wait during regular dining hours for a table.
author: Kid F.

description: Excellent quality Thai food. Best Tom Yum I've ever had. Overall pleasant service and top notch food. We get take out from here once a week for the last 4 months, never disappoints.
author: Gina M.

description: Visiting San Francisco and ate there one time. Their Papaya salad was flavored evenly and very flavorful. They had these rice flour samosas filled with taro and yams that were yummy. The eggplant dish was succulent and cooked to perfection, not too oily. Their brown rice was mixed with some wild rice and cooked just right. The staff were so nice and good service. I can't say enough!
author: Mariko M.

description: I drove past this restaurant and I told my friend that that restaurant looked bad. It had a rusty weathered looking sign. The person working at the motel I was staying at highly recommend this restaurant. I am a college student and I went with two other students. We ordered the sweet and sour chicken fried rice, fried duck and a spicy chicken disk with flat noodles. This is by far the best Thai food I have ever had. Nothing was too sweet or too spicy. My only complant would be the portion sizes could have been slightly larger. We went in around 4 pm and waited 10 minuties for the chef to arrive, it was worth the wait. I have been to San Francisco more times than I can count and that was one of the best meals i've had.
author: Aaron J.

description: I have lived a few blocks away from here for years and never went just always thought it was a weird location, I always rode by it and recently thought what the hell I like thai. Rolled there with my roomates and have been back 4 times in the last 2 weeks. this place is awesome the food is great, service is good except sometime you have to wait a lil while for the bill wich sometimes can be annoying if you are in a rush, but aside from that everything is great. my roomate is vegan and they took care of him they knew how to change their dishes to fit his diet. great thai iced tea
author: lord v.

description: This restaurant is solid overall. Good curries -- pumpkin is indeed a noteworthy dish, papaya salad (my favorite!) and this appetizer that essentially looks like a fried and breaded drumstick, only the chicken meat has been shredded and mixed with veggies and noodles into a wonderful melange of good-tasting yumminess. I like the place because it has low-key character, good service, abundant parking (it's the Sunset!) and best of all, good prices for the food you get.
author: Frida K.

description: Delicious pumpkin curry! Brown rice available, too. Friendly staff and beautiful decor. Definitely a place to go back to ;p
author: Odizzle D.

description: totally tasty.  i had the grilled salmon and it was awesome and the veggies were steamed to perfection.  i ordered delivery and had forgotten my apt number and they took it with a smile.  can't wait to order from there again, delish!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: im not sure why i like this place, but its worth 4 stars to me. its a nice, intimate restaurant and the servers are all super friendly. i come here probably every other month for their curry. each type is pretty good, but the only thing is that they always cut the veggies way too big. the pad see ew is delicious and the pad thai is ok. prices are pretty cheap and service is fast.
author: Kelly K.

description: ive never had a bad meal there. food is fresh,  delicious, and reasonably priced. take out is fast, and when you sit in,i have found it pretty quite but thats b/c everyone is ordering in. so while it might look empty from the outside, the kitchen is pretty busy stirring up delicious thai.....
author: SF Native M.

description: I love this place!  My husband does not eat thai food, so every time he goes out for the night I get delivery!!  I can't get enough of the Pad Himapan with crispy prawns!  Also, the fresh rolls are great...but I do not care for the dipping sauce.  I was hooked on the pa naeng curry for a while.  Also, really enjoy the spring roll!  The tom kha soup is flavorful, but the chicken can be a bit dry.  I have never had anything bad here!  Thanks for the great food and super fast delivery!!!
author: Katie N.

description: We have been going here for about 3 years now , and still think this is the best Thai place in San Francisco (which says a lot).  The people are great, and we've never left disappointed.  Their eggplant in particular is awesome.
author: Larry M.

description: I love the Tom Yom with shrimp.  This is the only Thai place in the area that I've tried with awesome soup.  It is so tasty.  Went there with my friends and one had a toddler.   Everyone really enjoyed their meals.  Only four stars because they are not open for lunch during the week.  The one on the corner is, and it was gross.  Tom Yom really stunk there.
author: Tano N.

description: Pumpkin Curry, Pad Thai, it's all so delicious.  I love the quaint quiet atmosphere, never a wait.  I love to stop here after a day in the park or just before catching the sunset at the beach a few blocks away!
author: Melissa L.

description: Sri Thai has great food. One of the dishes I got was the Spicy Mango Shrimp. If you like spicy, get this, but you can also ask them to ease up on the spicy if it's burning up your mouth like it did mine! Other dishes were the pineapple fried rice, fried calamari, pumpkin curry, and garlic pork (forgot the Thai name) dish. They were all very delicious. The Thai Iced Tea was too sweet though. The prices are very decent with the majority of the menu priced under $10 per dish. All in all, a great place to dine.
author: Amelia G.

description: i LOOOOVE this place. it was first recommended to me by my bff who said it was her favorite thai place, and since shes the most critical person of thai food that i know, i decided id try it. so me and my father hit it up and ordered stuffed mushrooms (WHICH I CRAVE LIKE EVERYYYDAY EVER SINCE), and the seafood pad see ew. --- both were near perfection. its a cozy little place, its super clean and theres absolutely no noise so your completely comfortable the whole time.
author: alana v.

description: Absolutely the best thai food!!! The prices are great, the portions are big, and the taste is as good as thai food gets. I dont remember the names of the dishes, but I have tried pad thai and chicken red curry at many thai restaurants and theirs is the best. They have a coconut soup for $2.95 and it has really good quality chicken breast and mushrooms. Their brown rice is so fluffy and flavorful. The food is refreshing with the fresh ingredients. There is plenty of free parking on the street as well. Go try it and you will be hooked.
author: John J.

description: cute, cozy thai restaurant that is pretty cheap way out by ocean beach. plenty of street parking. i don't think that many people know this restaurant exists, so it is pretty quiet and a nice place to go if you want to be able to linger over dinner and have a semi private conversation. the menu is your average thai selection-- nothing particularly stands out, but the food is solid. the wine selection isn't the greatest, but there are a few options. the service is pretty fantastic; the wait staff is attentive and friendly without being intrusive. this is my pick for when i have a thai craving and want to go out to dinner without the hassle of dealing with crowds or people.
author: Mary Beth D.
